8962 void QCustomPlot::setBackgroundScaledMode(Qt::AspectRatioMode mode)
8963 {
8964  mBackgroundScaledMode = mode;
8965 }
8966 
8975 QCPAbstractPlottable *QCustomPlot::plottable(int index)
8976 {
8977  if (index >= 0 && index < mPlottables.size())
8978  {
8979  return mPlottables.at(index);
8980  } else
8981  {
8982  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "index out of bounds:" << index;
8983  return 0;
8984  }
8985 }
8986 
8994 QCPAbstractPlottable *QCustomPlot::plottable()
8995 {
8996  if (!mPlottables.isEmpty())
8997  {
8998  return mPlottables.last();
8999  } else
9000  return 0;
9001 }
9002 
9013 bool QCustomPlot::addPlottable(QCPAbstractPlottable *plottable)
9014 {
9015  if (mPlottables.contains(plottable))
9016  {
9017  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "plottable already added to this QCustomPlot:" << reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(plottable);
9018  return false;
9019  }
9020  if (plottable->parentPlot() != this)
9021  {
9022  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "plottable not created with this QCustomPlot as parent:" << reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(plottable);
9023  return false;
9024  }
9025 
9026  mPlottables.append(plottable);
9027  // possibly add plottable to legend:
9028  if (mAutoAddPlottableToLegend)
9029  plottable->addToLegend();
9030  // special handling for QCPGraphs to maintain the simple graph interface:
9031  if (QCPGraph *graph = qobject_cast<QCPGraph*>(plottable))
9032  mGraphs.append(graph);
9033  if (!plottable->layer()) // usually the layer is already set in the constructor of the plottable (via QCPLayerable constructor)
9034  plottable->setLayer(currentLayer());
9035  return true;
9036 }
9037 
9045 bool QCustomPlot::removePlottable(QCPAbstractPlottable *plottable)
9046 {
9047  if (!mPlottables.contains(plottable))
9048  {
9049  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "plottable not in list:" << reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(plottable);
9050  return false;
9051  }
9052 
9053  // remove plottable from legend:
9054  plottable->removeFromLegend();
9055  // special handling for QCPGraphs to maintain the simple graph interface:
9056  if (QCPGraph *graph = qobject_cast<QCPGraph*>(plottable))
9057  mGraphs.removeOne(graph);
9058  // remove plottable:
9059  delete plottable;
9060  mPlottables.removeOne(plottable);
9061  return true;
9062 }
9063 
9068 bool QCustomPlot::removePlottable(int index)
9069 {
9070  if (index >= 0 && index < mPlottables.size())
9071  return removePlottable(mPlottables[index]);
9072  else
9073  {
9074  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "index out of bounds:" << index;
9075  return false;
9076  }
9077 }
9078 
9086 int QCustomPlot::clearPlottables()
9087 {
9088  int c = mPlottables.size();
9089  for (int i=c-1; i >= 0; --i)
9090  removePlottable(mPlottables[i]);
9091  return c;
9092 }
9093 
9099 int QCustomPlot::plottableCount() const
9100 {
9101  return mPlottables.size();
9102 }
9103 
9111 QList<QCPAbstractPlottable*> QCustomPlot::selectedPlottables() const
9112 {
9113  QList<QCPAbstractPlottable*> result;
9114  for (int i=0; i<mPlottables.size(); ++i)
9115  {
9116  if (mPlottables.at(i)->selected())
9117  result.append(mPlottables.at(i));
9118  }
9119  return result;
9120 }
9121 
9134 QCPAbstractPlottable *QCustomPlot::plottableAt(const QPointF &pos, bool onlySelectable) const
9135 {
9136  QCPAbstractPlottable *resultPlottable = 0;
9137  double resultDistance = mSelectionTolerance; // only regard clicks with distances smaller than mSelectionTolerance as selections, so initialize with that value
9138 
9139  for (int i=0; i<mPlottables.size(); ++i)
9140  {
9141  QCPAbstractPlottable *currentPlottable = mPlottables.at(i);
9142  if (onlySelectable && !currentPlottable->selectable()) // we could have also passed onlySelectable to the selectTest function, but checking here is faster, because we have access to QCPabstractPlottable::selectable
9143  continue;
9144  if ((currentPlottable->keyAxis()->axisRect()->rect() & currentPlottable->valueAxis()->axisRect()->rect()).contains(pos.toPoint())) // only consider clicks inside the rect that is spanned by the plottable's key/value axes
9145  {
9146  double currentDistance = currentPlottable->selectTest(pos, false);
9147  if (currentDistance >= 0 && currentDistance < resultDistance)
9148  {
9149  resultPlottable = currentPlottable;
9150  resultDistance = currentDistance;
9151  }
9152  }
9153  }
9154 
9155  return resultPlottable;
9156 }
9157 
9163 bool QCustomPlot::hasPlottable(QCPAbstractPlottable *plottable) const
9164 {
9165  return mPlottables.contains(plottable);
9166 }
9167 
9176 QCPGraph *QCustomPlot::graph(int index) const
9177 {
9178  if (index >= 0 && index < mGraphs.size())
9179  {
9180  return mGraphs.at(index);
9181  } else
9182  {
9183  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "index out of bounds:" << index;
9184  return 0;
9185  }
9186 }
9187 
9195 QCPGraph *QCustomPlot::graph() const
9196 {
9197  if (!mGraphs.isEmpty())
9198  {
9199  return mGraphs.last();
9200  } else
9201  return 0;
9202 }
9203 
9216 QCPGraph *QCustomPlot::addGraph(QCPAxis *keyAxis, QCPAxis *valueAxis)
9217 {
9218  if (!keyAxis) keyAxis = xAxis;
9219  if (!valueAxis) valueAxis = yAxis;
9220  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis)
9221  {
9222  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "can't use default QCustomPlot xAxis or yAxis, because at least one is invalid (has been deleted)";
9223  return 0;
9224  }
9225  if (keyAxis->parentPlot() != this || valueAxis->parentPlot() != this)
9226  {
9227  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "passed keyAxis or valueAxis doesn't have this QCustomPlot as parent";
9228  return 0;
9229  }
9230 
9231  QCPGraph *newGraph = new QCPGraph(keyAxis, valueAxis);
9232  if (addPlottable(newGraph))
9233  {
9234  newGraph->setName("Graph "+QString::number(mGraphs.size()));
9235  return newGraph;
9236  } else
9237  {
9238  delete newGraph;
9239  return 0;
9240  }
9241 }
9242 
9252 bool QCustomPlot::removeGraph(QCPGraph *graph)
9253 {
9254  return removePlottable(graph);
9255 }
9256 
9261 bool QCustomPlot::removeGraph(int index)
9262 {
9263  if (index >= 0 && index < mGraphs.size())
9264  return removeGraph(mGraphs[index]);
9265  else
9266  return false;
9267 }
9268 
9276 int QCustomPlot::clearGraphs()
9277 {
9278  int c = mGraphs.size();
9279  for (int i=c-1; i >= 0; --i)
9280  removeGraph(mGraphs[i]);
9281  return c;
9282 }
9283 
9289 int QCustomPlot::graphCount() const
9290 {
9291  return mGraphs.size();
9292 }
9293 
9302 QList<QCPGraph*> QCustomPlot::selectedGraphs() const
9303 {
9304  QList<QCPGraph*> result;
9305  for (int i=0; i<mGraphs.size(); ++i)
9306  {
9307  if (mGraphs.at(i)->selected())
9308  result.append(mGraphs.at(i));
9309  }
9310  return result;
9311 }
9312

9323  if (index >= 0 && index < mItems.size())
9324  {
9325  return mItems.at(index);
9326  } else
9327  {
9328  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "index out of bounds:" << index;
9329  return 0;
9330  }
9331 }

9340 QCPAbstractItem *QCustomPlot::item() const
9341 {
9342  if (!mItems.isEmpty())
9343  {
9344  return mItems.last();
9345  } else
9346  return 0;
9347 }
9348 
9357 bool QCustomPlot::addItem(QCPAbstractItem *item)
9358 {
9359  if (!mItems.contains(item) && item->parentPlot() == this)
9360  {
9361  mItems.append(item);
9362  return true;
9363  } else
9364  {
9365  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "item either already in list or not created with this QCustomPlot as parent:" << reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(item);
9366  return false;
9367  }
9368 }
9369 
9377 bool QCustomPlot::removeItem(QCPAbstractItem *item)
9378 {
9379  if (mItems.contains(item))
9380  {
9381  delete item;
9382  mItems.removeOne(item);
9383  return true;
9384  } else
9385  {
9386  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "item not in list:" << reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(item);
9387  return false;
9388  }
9389 }
9390 
9395 bool QCustomPlot::removeItem(int index)
9396 {
9397  if (index >= 0 && index < mItems.size())
9398  return removeItem(mItems[index]);
9399  else
9400  {
9401  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "index out of bounds:" << index;
9402  return false;
9403  }
9404 }
9405 
9413 int QCustomPlot::clearItems()
9414 {
9415  int c = mItems.size();
9416  for (int i=c-1; i >= 0; --i)
9417  removeItem(mItems[i]);
9418  return c;
9419 }
9420 
9426 int QCustomPlot::itemCount() const
9427 {
9428  return mItems.size();
9429 }
9430 
9436 QList<QCPAbstractItem*> QCustomPlot::selectedItems() const
9437 {
9438  QList<QCPAbstractItem*> result;
9439  for (int i=0; i<mItems.size(); ++i)
9440  {
9441  if (mItems.at(i)->selected())
9442  result.append(mItems.at(i));
9443  }
9444  return result;
9445 }
9446 
9460 QCPAbstractItem *QCustomPlot::itemAt(const QPointF &pos, bool onlySelectable) const
9461 {
9462  QCPAbstractItem *resultItem = 0;
9463  double resultDistance = mSelectionTolerance; // only regard clicks with distances smaller than mSelectionTolerance as selections, so initialize with that value
9464 
9465  for (int i=0; i<mItems.size(); ++i)
9466  {
9467  QCPAbstractItem *currentItem = mItems[i];
9468  if (onlySelectable && !currentItem->selectable()) // we could have also passed onlySelectable to the selectTest function, but checking here is faster, because we have access to QCPAbstractItem::selectable
9469  continue;
9470  if (!currentItem->clipToAxisRect() || currentItem->clipRect().contains(pos.toPoint())) // only consider clicks inside axis cliprect of the item if actually clipped to it
9471  {
9472  double currentDistance = currentItem->selectTest(pos, false);
9473  if (currentDistance >= 0 && currentDistance < resultDistance)
9474  {
9475  resultItem = currentItem;
9476  resultDistance = currentDistance;
9477  }
9478  }
9479  }
9480 
9481  return resultItem;
9482 }
9483 
9489 bool QCustomPlot::hasItem(QCPAbstractItem *item) const
9490 {
9491  return mItems.contains(item);
9492 }
9493 
9502 QCPLayer *QCustomPlot::layer(const QString &name) const
9503 {
9504  for (int i=0; i<mLayers.size(); ++i)
9505  {
9506  if (mLayers.at(i)->name() == name)
9507  return mLayers.at(i);
9508  }
9509  return 0;
9510 }
9511 
9518 QCPLayer *QCustomPlot::layer(int index) const
9519 {
9520  if (index >= 0 && index < mLayers.size())
9521  {
9522  return mLayers.at(index);
9523  } else
9524  {
9525  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "index out of bounds:" << index;
9526  return 0;
9527  }
9528 }
9529 
9533 QCPLayer *QCustomPlot::currentLayer() const
9534 {
9535  return mCurrentLayer;
9536 }
9537 
9548 bool QCustomPlot::setCurrentLayer(const QString &name)
9549 {
9550  if (QCPLayer *newCurrentLayer = layer(name))
9551  {
9552  return setCurrentLayer(newCurrentLayer);
9553  } else
9554  {
9555  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "layer with name doesn't exist:" << name;
9556  return false;
9557  }
9558 }
9559 
9568 bool QCustomPlot::setCurrentLayer(QCPLayer *layer)
9569 {
9570  if (!mLayers.contains(layer))
9571  {
9572  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "layer not a layer of this QCustomPlot:" << reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(layer);
9573  return false;
9574  }
9575 
9576  mCurrentLayer = layer;
9577  return true;
9578 }
9579 
9585 int QCustomPlot::layerCount() const
9586 {
9587  return mLayers.size();
9588 }
9589 
9603 bool QCustomPlot::addLayer(const QString &name, QCPLayer *otherLayer, QCustomPlot::LayerInsertMode insertMode)
9604 {
9605  if (!otherLayer)
9606  otherLayer = mLayers.last();
9607  if (!mLayers.contains(otherLayer))
9608  {
9609  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "otherLayer not a layer of this QCustomPlot:" << reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(otherLayer);
9610  return false;
9611  }
9612  if (layer(name))
9613  {
9614  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "A layer exists already with the name" << name;
9615  return false;
9616  }
9617 
9618  QCPLayer *newLayer = new QCPLayer(this, name);
9619  mLayers.insert(otherLayer->index() + (insertMode==limAbove ? 1:0), newLayer);
9620  updateLayerIndices();
9621  return true;
9622 }
9623 
9638 bool QCustomPlot::removeLayer(QCPLayer *layer)
9639 {
9640  if (!mLayers.contains(layer))
9641  {
9642  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "layer not a layer of this QCustomPlot:" << reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(layer);
9643  return false;
9644  }
9645  if (mLayers.size() < 2)
9646  {
9647  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "can't remove last layer";
9648  return false;
9649  }
9650 
9651  // append all children of this layer to layer below (if this is lowest layer, prepend to layer above)
9652  int removedIndex = layer->index();
9653  bool isFirstLayer = removedIndex==0;
9654  QCPLayer *targetLayer = isFirstLayer ? mLayers.at(removedIndex+1) : mLayers.at(removedIndex-1);
9655  QList<QCPLayerable*> children = layer->children();
9656  if (isFirstLayer) // prepend in reverse order (so order relative to each other stays the same)
9657  {
9658  for (int i=children.size()-1; i>=0; --i)
9659  children.at(i)->moveToLayer(targetLayer, true);
9660  } else // append normally
9661  {
9662  for (int i=0; i<children.size(); ++i)
9663  children.at(i)->moveToLayer(targetLayer, false);
9664  }
9665  // if removed layer is current layer, change current layer to layer below/above:
9666  if (layer == mCurrentLayer)
9667  setCurrentLayer(targetLayer);
9668  // remove layer:
9669  delete layer;
9670  mLayers.removeOne(layer);
9671  updateLayerIndices();
9672  return true;
9673 }
9674 
9684 bool QCustomPlot::moveLayer(QCPLayer *layer, QCPLayer *otherLayer, QCustomPlot::LayerInsertMode insertMode)
9685 {
9686  if (!mLayers.contains(layer))
9687  {
9688  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "layer not a layer of this QCustomPlot:" << reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(layer);
9689  return false;
9690  }
9691  if (!mLayers.contains(otherLayer))
9692  {
9693  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "otherLayer not a layer of this QCustomPlot:" << reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(otherLayer);
9694  return false;
9695  }
9696 
9697  mLayers.move(layer->index(), otherLayer->index() + (insertMode==limAbove ? 1:0));
9698  updateLayerIndices();
9699  return true;
9700 }
9701 
9711 int QCustomPlot::axisRectCount() const
9712 {
9713  return axisRects().size();
9714 }
9715 
9725 QCPAxisRect *QCustomPlot::axisRect(int index) const
9726 {
9727  const QList<QCPAxisRect*> rectList = axisRects();
9728  if (index >= 0 && index < rectList.size())
9729  {
9730  return rectList.at(index);
9731  } else
9732  {
9733  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid axis rect index" << index;
9734  return 0;
9735  }
9736 }
9737 
9743 QList<QCPAxisRect*> QCustomPlot::axisRects() const
9744 {
9745  QList<QCPAxisRect*> result;
9746  QStack<QCPLayoutElement*> elementStack;
9747  if (mPlotLayout)
9748  elementStack.push(mPlotLayout);
9749 
9750  while (!elementStack.isEmpty())
9751  {
9752  QList<QCPLayoutElement*> subElements = elementStack.pop()->elements(false);
9753  for (int i=0; i<subElements.size(); ++i)
9754  {
9755  if (QCPLayoutElement *element = subElements.at(i))
9756  {
9757  elementStack.push(element);
9758  if (QCPAxisRect *ar = qobject_cast<QCPAxisRect*>(element))
9759  result.append(ar);
9760  }
9761  }
9762  }
9763 
9764  return result;
9765 }
9766 
9776 QCPLayoutElement *QCustomPlot::layoutElementAt(const QPointF &pos) const
9777 {
9778  QCPLayoutElement *current = mPlotLayout;
9779  bool searchSubElements = true;
9780  while (searchSubElements && current)
9781  {
9782  searchSubElements = false;
9783  const QList<QCPLayoutElement*> elements = current->elements(false);
9784  for (int i=0; i<elements.size(); ++i)
9785  {
9786  if (elements.at(i) && elements.at(i)->realVisibility() && elements.at(i)->selectTest(pos, false) >= 0)
9787  {
9788  current = elements.at(i);
9789  searchSubElements = true;
9790  break;
9791  }
9792  }
9793  }
9794  return current;
9795 }
9796 
9804 QList<QCPAxis*> QCustomPlot::selectedAxes() const
9805 {
9806  QList<QCPAxis*> result, allAxes;
9807  QList<QCPAxisRect*> rects = axisRects();
9808  for (int i=0; i<rects.size(); ++i)
9809  allAxes << rects.at(i)->axes();
9810 
9811  for (int i=0; i<allAxes.size(); ++i)
9812  {
9813  if (allAxes.at(i)->selectedParts() != QCPAxis::spNone)
9814  result.append(allAxes.at(i));
9815  }
9816 
9817  return result;
9818 }
9819 
9827 QList<QCPLegend*> QCustomPlot::selectedLegends() const
9828 {
9829  QList<QCPLegend*> result;
9830 
9831  QStack<QCPLayoutElement*> elementStack;
9832  if (mPlotLayout)
9833  elementStack.push(mPlotLayout);
9834 
9835  while (!elementStack.isEmpty())
9836  {
9837  QList<QCPLayoutElement*> subElements = elementStack.pop()->elements(false);
9838  for (int i=0; i<subElements.size(); ++i)
9839  {
9840  if (QCPLayoutElement *element = subElements.at(i))
9841  {
9842  elementStack.push(element);
9843  if (QCPLegend *leg = qobject_cast<QCPLegend*>(element))
9844  {
9845  if (leg->selectedParts() != QCPLegend::spNone)
9846  result.append(leg);
9847  }
9848  }
9849  }
9850  }
9851 
9852  return result;
9853 }
9854 
9864 void QCustomPlot::deselectAll()
9865 {
9866  for (int i=0; i<mLayers.size(); ++i)
9867  {
9868  QList<QCPLayerable*> layerables = mLayers.at(i)->children();
9869  for (int k=0; k<layerables.size(); ++k)
9870  layerables.at(k)->deselectEvent(0);
9871  }
9872 }
9873 
9887 void QCustomPlot::replot()
9888 {
9889  if (mReplotting) // incase signals loop back to replot slot
9890  return;
9891  mReplotting = true;
9892  emit beforeReplot();
9893  mPaintBuffer.fill(mBackgroundBrush.style() == Qt::SolidPattern ? mBackgroundBrush.color() : Qt::transparent);
9894  QCPPainter painter;
9895  painter.begin(&mPaintBuffer);
9896  if (painter.isActive())
9897  {
9898  painter.setRenderHint(QPainter::HighQualityAntialiasing); // to make Antialiasing look good if using the OpenGL graphicssystem
9899  if (mBackgroundBrush.style() != Qt::SolidPattern && mBackgroundBrush.style() != Qt::NoBrush)
9900  painter.fillRect(mViewport, mBackgroundBrush);
9901  draw(&painter);
9902  painter.end();
9903  if (mPlottingHints.testFlag(QCP::phForceRepaint))
9904  repaint();
9905  else
9906  update();
9907  } else // might happen if QCustomPlot has width or height zero
9908  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "Couldn't activate painter on buffer";
9909  emit afterReplot();
9910  mReplotting = false;
9911 }
9912 
9922 void QCustomPlot::rescaleAxes(bool onlyVisible)
9923 {
9924  if (mPlottables.isEmpty()) return;
9925  bool firstPlottable = true;
9926 
9927  for (int i=0; i<mPlottables.size(); ++i)
9928  {
9929  if (mPlottables.at(i)->realVisibility() || !onlyVisible)
9930  {
9931  mPlottables.at(i)->rescaleAxes(!firstPlottable); // onlyEnlarge disabled on first plottable
9932  firstPlottable = false;
9933  }
9934  }
9935 }
9936 
9968 bool QCustomPlot::savePdf(const QString &fileName, bool noCosmeticPen, int width, int height)
9969 {
9970  bool success = false;
9971  int newWidth, newHeight;
9972  if (width == 0 || height == 0)
9973  {
9974  newWidth = this->width();
9975  newHeight = this->height();
9976  } else
9977  {
9978  newWidth = width;
9979  newHeight = height;
9980  }
9981 
9982  QPrinter printer(QPrinter::ScreenResolution);
9983  printer.setOutputFileName(fileName);
9984  printer.setOutputFormat(QPrinter::PdfFormat);
9985  printer.setFullPage(true);
9986  QRect oldViewport = viewport();
9987  setViewport(QRect(0, 0, newWidth, newHeight));
9988  printer.setPaperSize(viewport().size(), QPrinter::DevicePixel);
9989  QCPPainter printpainter;
9990  if (printpainter.begin(&printer))
9991  {
9992  printpainter.setMode(QCPPainter::pmVectorized);
9993  printpainter.setMode(QCPPainter::pmNoCaching);
9994  printpainter.setMode(QCPPainter::pmNonCosmetic, noCosmeticPen);
9995  printpainter.setWindow(mViewport);
9996  if (mBackgroundBrush.style() != Qt::NoBrush &&
9997  mBackgroundBrush.color() != Qt::white &&
9998  mBackgroundBrush.color() != Qt::transparent &&
9999  mBackgroundBrush.color().alpha() > 0) // draw pdf background color if not white/transparent
10000  printpainter.fillRect(viewport(), mBackgroundBrush);
10001  draw(&printpainter);
10002  printpainter.end();
10003  success = true;
10004  }
10005  setViewport(oldViewport);
10006  return success;
10007 }
10008 
10046 bool QCustomPlot::savePng(const QString &fileName, int width, int height, double scale, int quality)
10047 {
10048  return saveRastered(fileName, width, height, scale, "PNG", quality);
10049 }
10050 
10085 bool QCustomPlot::saveJpg(const QString &fileName, int width, int height, double scale, int quality)
10086 {
10087  return saveRastered(fileName, width, height, scale, "JPG", quality);
10088 }
10089 
10121 bool QCustomPlot::saveBmp(const QString &fileName, int width, int height, double scale)
10122 {
10123  return saveRastered(fileName, width, height, scale, "BMP");
10124 }
10125 
10134 QSize QCustomPlot::minimumSizeHint() const
10135 {
10136  return mPlotLayout->minimumSizeHint();
10137 }
10138 
10144 QSize QCustomPlot::sizeHint() const
10145 {
10146  return mPlotLayout->minimumSizeHint();
10147 }
10148 
10154 void QCustomPlot::paintEvent(QPaintEvent *event)
10155 {
10156  Q_UNUSED(event);
10157  QPainter painter(this);
10158  painter.drawPixmap(0, 0, mPaintBuffer);
10159 }
10160 
10167 void QCustomPlot::resizeEvent(QResizeEvent *event)
10168 {
10169  // resize and repaint the buffer:
10170  mPaintBuffer = QPixmap(event->size());
10171  setViewport(rect());
10172  replot();
10173 }
10174 
10184 void QCustomPlot::mouseDoubleClickEvent(QMouseEvent *event)
10185 {
10186  emit mouseDoubleClick(event);
10187 
10188  QVariant details;
10189  QCPLayerable *clickedLayerable = layerableAt(event->pos(), false, &details);
10190 
10191  // emit specialized object double click signals:
10192  if (QCPAbstractPlottable *ap = qobject_cast<QCPAbstractPlottable*>(clickedLayerable))
10193  emit plottableDoubleClick(ap, event);
10194  else if (QCPAxis *ax = qobject_cast<QCPAxis*>(clickedLayerable))
10195  emit axisDoubleClick(ax, details.value<QCPAxis::SelectablePart>(), event);
10196  else if (QCPAbstractItem *ai = qobject_cast<QCPAbstractItem*>(clickedLayerable))
10197  emit itemDoubleClick(ai, event);
10198  else if (QCPLegend *lg = qobject_cast<QCPLegend*>(clickedLayerable))
10199  emit legendDoubleClick(lg, 0, event);
10200  else if (QCPAbstractLegendItem *li = qobject_cast<QCPAbstractLegendItem*>(clickedLayerable))
10201  emit legendDoubleClick(li->parentLegend(), li, event);
10202  else if (QCPPlotTitle *pt = qobject_cast<QCPPlotTitle*>(clickedLayerable))
10203  emit titleDoubleClick(event, pt);
10204 
10205  // call double click event of affected layout element:
10206  if (QCPLayoutElement *el = layoutElementAt(event->pos()))
10207  el->mouseDoubleClickEvent(event);
10208 
10209  // call release event of affected layout element (as in mouseReleaseEvent, since the mouseDoubleClick replaces the second release event in double click case):
10210  if (mMouseEventElement)
10211  {
10212  mMouseEventElement->mouseReleaseEvent(event);
10213  mMouseEventElement = 0;
10214  }
10215 
10216  //QWidget::mouseDoubleClickEvent(event); don't call base class implementation because it would just cause a mousePress/ReleaseEvent, which we don't want.
10217 }
10218 
10226 void QCustomPlot::mousePressEvent(QMouseEvent *event)
10227 {
10228  emit mousePress(event);
10229  mMousePressPos = event->pos(); // need this to determine in releaseEvent whether it was a click (no position change between press and release)
10230 
10231  // call event of affected layout element:
10232  mMouseEventElement = layoutElementAt(event->pos());
10233  if (mMouseEventElement)
10234  mMouseEventElement->mousePressEvent(event);
10235 
10236  QWidget::mousePressEvent(event);
10237 }
10238 
10248 void QCustomPlot::mouseMoveEvent(QMouseEvent *event)
10249 {
10250  emit mouseMove(event);
10251 
10252  // call event of affected layout element:
10253  if (mMouseEventElement)
10254  mMouseEventElement->mouseMoveEvent(event);
10255 
10256  QWidget::mouseMoveEvent(event);
10257 }
10258 
10273 void QCustomPlot::mouseReleaseEvent(QMouseEvent *event)
10274 {
10275  emit mouseRelease(event);
10276  bool doReplot = false;
10277 
10278  if ((mMousePressPos-event->pos()).manhattanLength() < 5) // determine whether it was a click operation
10279  {
10280  if (event->button() == Qt::LeftButton)
10281  {
10282  // handle selection mechanism:
10283  QVariant details;
10284  QCPLayerable *clickedLayerable = layerableAt(event->pos(), true, &details);
10285  bool selectionStateChanged = false;
10286  bool additive = mInteractions.testFlag(QCP::iMultiSelect) && event->modifiers().testFlag(mMultiSelectModifier);
10287  if (clickedLayerable && mInteractions.testFlag(clickedLayerable->selectionCategory()))
10288  {
10289  // a layerable was actually clicked, call its selectEvent:
10290  bool selChanged = false;
10291  clickedLayerable->selectEvent(event, additive, details, &selChanged);
10292  selectionStateChanged |= selChanged;
10293  }
10294  // deselect all other layerables if not additive selection:
10295  if (!additive)
10296  {
10297  for (int i=0; i<mLayers.size(); ++i)
10298  {
10299  QList<QCPLayerable*> layerables = mLayers.at(i)->children();
10300  for (int k=0; k<layerables.size(); ++k)
10301  {
10302  if (layerables.at(k) != clickedLayerable && mInteractions.testFlag(layerables.at(k)->selectionCategory()))
10303  {
10304  bool selChanged = false;
10305  layerables.at(k)->deselectEvent(&selChanged);
10306  selectionStateChanged |= selChanged;
10307  }
10308  }
10309  }
10310  }
10311  doReplot = true;
10312  if (selectionStateChanged)
10313  emit selectionChangedByUser();
10314  }
10315 
10316  // emit specialized object click signals:
10317  QVariant details;
10318  QCPLayerable *clickedLayerable = layerableAt(event->pos(), false, &details); // for these signals, selectability is ignored, that's why we call this again with onlySelectable set to false
10319  if (QCPAbstractPlottable *ap = qobject_cast<QCPAbstractPlottable*>(clickedLayerable))
10320  emit plottableClick(ap, event);
10321  else if (QCPAxis *ax = qobject_cast<QCPAxis*>(clickedLayerable))
10322  emit axisClick(ax, details.value<QCPAxis::SelectablePart>(), event);
10323  else if (QCPAbstractItem *ai = qobject_cast<QCPAbstractItem*>(clickedLayerable))
10324  emit itemClick(ai, event);
10325  else if (QCPLegend *lg = qobject_cast<QCPLegend*>(clickedLayerable))
10326  emit legendClick(lg, 0, event);
10327  else if (QCPAbstractLegendItem *li = qobject_cast<QCPAbstractLegendItem*>(clickedLayerable))
10328  emit legendClick(li->parentLegend(), li, event);
10329  else if (QCPPlotTitle *pt = qobject_cast<QCPPlotTitle*>(clickedLayerable))
10330  emit titleClick(event, pt);
10331  }
10332 
10333  // call event of affected layout element:
10334  if (mMouseEventElement)
10335  {
10336  mMouseEventElement->mouseReleaseEvent(event);
10337  mMouseEventElement = 0;
10338  }
10339 
10340  if (doReplot || noAntialiasingOnDrag())
10341  replot();
10342 
10343  QWidget::mouseReleaseEvent(event);
10344 }
10345 
10352 void QCustomPlot::wheelEvent(QWheelEvent *event)
10353 {
10354  emit mouseWheel(event);
10355 
10356  // call event of affected layout element:
10357  if (QCPLayoutElement *el = layoutElementAt(event->pos()))
10358  el->wheelEvent(event);
10359 
10360  QWidget::wheelEvent(event);
10361 }
10362 
10370 void QCustomPlot::draw(QCPPainter *painter)
10371 {
10372  // update all axis tick vectors:
10373  QList<QCPAxisRect*> rects = axisRects();
10374  for (int i=0; i<rects.size(); ++i)
10375  {
10376  QList<QCPAxis*> axes = rects.at(i)->axes();
10377  for (int k=0; k<axes.size(); ++k)
10378  axes.at(k)->setupTickVectors();
10379  }
10380 
10381  // recalculate layout:
10382  mPlotLayout->update();
10383 
10384  // draw viewport background pixmap:
10385  drawBackground(painter);
10386 
10387  // draw all layered objects (grid, axes, plottables, items, legend,...):
10388  for (int layerIndex=0; layerIndex < mLayers.size(); ++layerIndex)
10389  {
10390  QList<QCPLayerable*> layerChildren = mLayers.at(layerIndex)->children();
10391  for (int k=0; k < layerChildren.size(); ++k)
10392  {
10393  QCPLayerable *child = layerChildren.at(k);
10394  if (child->realVisibility())
10395  {
10396  painter->save();
10397  painter->setClipRect(child->clipRect().translated(0, -1));
10398  child->applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
10399  child->draw(painter);
10400  painter->restore();
10401  }
10402  }
10403  }
10404 }
10405 
10423 void QCustomPlot::drawBackground(QCPPainter *painter)
10424 {
10425  // Note: background color is handled in individual replot/save functions
10426 
10427  // draw background pixmap (on top of fill, if brush specified):
10428  if (!mBackgroundPixmap.isNull())
10429  {
10430  if (mBackgroundScaled)
10431  {
10432  // check whether mScaledBackground needs to be updated:
10433  QSize scaledSize(mBackgroundPixmap.size());
10434  scaledSize.scale(mViewport.size(), mBackgroundScaledMode);
10435  if (mScaledBackgroundPixmap.size() != scaledSize)
10436  mScaledBackgroundPixmap = mBackgroundPixmap.scaled(mViewport.size(), mBackgroundScaledMode, Qt::SmoothTransformation);
10437  painter->drawPixmap(mViewport.topLeft(), mScaledBackgroundPixmap, QRect(0, 0, mViewport.width(), mViewport.height()) & mScaledBackgroundPixmap.rect());
10438  } else
10439  {
10440  painter->drawPixmap(mViewport.topLeft(), mBackgroundPixmap, QRect(0, 0, mViewport.width(), mViewport.height()));
10441  }
10442  }
10443 }
10444 
10445 
10451 void QCustomPlot::axisRemoved(QCPAxis *axis)
10452 {
10453  if (xAxis == axis)
10454  xAxis = 0;
10455  if (xAxis2 == axis)
10456  xAxis2 = 0;
10457  if (yAxis == axis)
10458  yAxis = 0;
10459  if (yAxis2 == axis)
10460  yAxis2 = 0;
10461 
10462  // Note: No need to take care of range drag axes and range zoom axes, because they are stored in smart pointers
10463 }
10464 
10470 void QCustomPlot::legendRemoved(QCPLegend *legend)
10471 {
10472  if (this->legend == legend)
10473  this->legend = 0;
10474 }
10475 
10482 void QCustomPlot::updateLayerIndices() const
10483 {
10484  for (int i=0; i<mLayers.size(); ++i)
10485  mLayers.at(i)->mIndex = i;
10486 }
10487 
10500 QCPLayerable *QCustomPlot::layerableAt(const QPointF &pos, bool onlySelectable, QVariant *selectionDetails) const
10501 {
10502  for (int layerIndex=mLayers.size()-1; layerIndex>=0; --layerIndex)
10503  {
10504  const QList<QCPLayerable*> layerables = mLayers.at(layerIndex)->children();
10505  double minimumDistance = selectionTolerance()*1.1;
10506  QCPLayerable *minimumDistanceLayerable = 0;
10507  for (int i=layerables.size()-1; i>=0; --i)
10508  {
10509  if (!layerables.at(i)->realVisibility())
10510  continue;
10511  QVariant details;
10512  double dist = layerables.at(i)->selectTest(pos, onlySelectable, &details);
10513  if (dist >= 0 && dist < minimumDistance)
10514  {
10515  minimumDistance = dist;
10516  minimumDistanceLayerable = layerables.at(i);
10517  if (selectionDetails) *selectionDetails = details;
10518  }
10519  }
10520  if (minimumDistance < selectionTolerance())
10521  return minimumDistanceLayerable;
10522  }
10523  return 0;
10524 }
10525 
10537 bool QCustomPlot::saveRastered(const QString &fileName, int width, int height, double scale, const char *format, int quality)
10538 {
10539  QPixmap buffer = toPixmap(width, height, scale);
10540  if (!buffer.isNull())
10541  return buffer.save(fileName, format, quality);
10542  else
10543  return false;
10544 }
10545 
10554 QPixmap QCustomPlot::toPixmap(int width, int height, double scale)
10555 {
10556  // this method is somewhat similar to toPainter. Change something here, and a change in toPainter might be necessary, too.
10557  int newWidth, newHeight;
10558  if (width == 0 || height == 0)
10559  {
10560  newWidth = this->width();
10561  newHeight = this->height();
10562  } else
10563  {
10564  newWidth = width;
10565  newHeight = height;
10566  }
10567  int scaledWidth = qRound(scale*newWidth);
10568  int scaledHeight = qRound(scale*newHeight);
10569 
10570  QPixmap result(scaledWidth, scaledHeight);
10571  result.fill(mBackgroundBrush.style() == Qt::SolidPattern ? mBackgroundBrush.color() : Qt::transparent); // if using non-solid pattern, make transparent now and draw brush pattern later
10572  QCPPainter painter;
10573  painter.begin(&result);
10574  if (painter.isActive())
10575  {
10576  QRect oldViewport = viewport();
10577  setViewport(QRect(0, 0, newWidth, newHeight));
10578  painter.setMode(QCPPainter::pmNoCaching);
10579  if (!qFuzzyCompare(scale, 1.0))
10580  {
10581  if (scale > 1.0) // for scale < 1 we always want cosmetic pens where possible, because else lines might disappear for very small scales
10582  painter.setMode(QCPPainter::pmNonCosmetic);
10583  painter.scale(scale, scale);
10584  }
10585  if (mBackgroundBrush.style() != Qt::SolidPattern && mBackgroundBrush.style() != Qt::NoBrush)
10586  painter.fillRect(mViewport, mBackgroundBrush);
10587  draw(&painter);
10588  setViewport(oldViewport);
10589  painter.end();
10590  } else // might happen if pixmap has width or height zero
10591  {
10592  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "Couldn't activate painter on pixmap";
10593  return QPixmap();
10594  }
10595  return result;
10596 }
10597 
10610 void QCustomPlot::toPainter(QCPPainter *painter, int width, int height)
10611 {
10612  // this method is somewhat similar to toPixmap. Change something here, and a change in toPixmap might be necessary, too.
10613  int newWidth, newHeight;
10614  if (width == 0 || height == 0)
10615  {
10616  newWidth = this->width();
10617  newHeight = this->height();
10618  } else
10619  {
10620  newWidth = width;
10621  newHeight = height;
10622  }
10623 
10624  if (painter->isActive())
10625  {
10626  QRect oldViewport = viewport();
10627  setViewport(QRect(0, 0, newWidth, newHeight));
10628  painter->setMode(QCPPainter::pmNoCaching);
10629  // warning: the following is different in toPixmap, because a solid background color is applied there via QPixmap::fill
10630  // here, we need to do this via QPainter::fillRect.
10631  if (mBackgroundBrush.style() != Qt::NoBrush)
10632  painter->fillRect(mViewport, mBackgroundBrush);
10633  draw(painter);
10634  setViewport(oldViewport);
10635  } else
10636  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "Passed painter is not active";
10637 }
10638 
10639 
10643 
10663 QCPData::QCPData() :
10664  key(0),
10665  value(0),
10666  keyErrorPlus(0),
10667  keyErrorMinus(0),
10668  valueErrorPlus(0),
10669  valueErrorMinus(0)
10670 {
10671 }
10672 
10676 QCPData::QCPData(double key, double value) :
10677  key(key),
10678  value(value),
10679  keyErrorPlus(0),
10680  keyErrorMinus(0),
10681  valueErrorPlus(0),
10682  valueErrorMinus(0)
10683 {
10684 }
10685 
10686 
10690 
10734 QCPGraph::QCPGraph(QCPAxis *keyAxis, QCPAxis *valueAxis) :
10735  QCPAbstractPlottable(keyAxis, valueAxis)
10736 {
10737  mData = new QCPDataMap;
10738 
10739  setPen(QPen(Qt::blue, 0));
10740  setErrorPen(QPen(Qt::black));
10741  setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
10742  setSelectedPen(QPen(QColor(80, 80, 255), 2.5));
10743  setSelectedBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
10744 
10745  setLineStyle(lsLine);
10746  setErrorType(etNone);
10747  setErrorBarSize(6);
10748  setErrorBarSkipSymbol(true);
10749  setChannelFillGraph(0);
10750 }
10751 
10752 QCPGraph::~QCPGraph()
10753 {
10754  delete mData;
10755 }
10756 
10764 void QCPGraph::setData(QCPDataMap *data, bool copy)
10765 {
10766  if (copy)
10767  {
10768  *mData = *data;
10769  } else
10770  {
10771  delete mData;
10772  mData = data;
10773  }
10774 }
10775 
10782 void QCPGraph::setData(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value)
10783 {
10784  mData->clear();
10785  int n = key.size();
10786  n = qMin(n, value.size());
10787  QCPData newData;
10788  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
10789  {
10790  newData.key = key[i];
10791  newData.value = value[i];
10792  mData->insertMulti(newData.key, newData);
10793  }
10794 }
10795 
10805 void QCPGraph::setDataValueError(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value, const QVector<double> &valueError)
10806 {
10807  mData->clear();
10808  int n = key.size();
10809  n = qMin(n, value.size());
10810  n = qMin(n, valueError.size());
10811  QCPData newData;
10812  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
10813  {
10814  newData.key = key[i];
10815  newData.value = value[i];
10816  newData.valueErrorMinus = valueError[i];
10817  newData.valueErrorPlus = valueError[i];
10818  mData->insertMulti(key[i], newData);
10819  }
10820 }
10821 
10831 void QCPGraph::setDataValueError(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value, const QVector<double> &valueErrorMinus, const QVector<double> &valueErrorPlus)
10832 {
10833  mData->clear();
10834  int n = key.size();
10835  n = qMin(n, value.size());
10836  n = qMin(n, valueErrorMinus.size());
10837  n = qMin(n, valueErrorPlus.size());
10838  QCPData newData;
10839  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
10840  {
10841  newData.key = key[i];
10842  newData.value = value[i];
10843  newData.valueErrorMinus = valueErrorMinus[i];
10844  newData.valueErrorPlus = valueErrorPlus[i];
10845  mData->insertMulti(key[i], newData);
10846  }
10847 }
10848 
10858 void QCPGraph::setDataKeyError(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value, const QVector<double> &keyError)
10859 {
10860  mData->clear();
10861  int n = key.size();
10862  n = qMin(n, value.size());
10863  n = qMin(n, keyError.size());
10864  QCPData newData;
10865  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
10866  {
10867  newData.key = key[i];
10868  newData.value = value[i];
10869  newData.keyErrorMinus = keyError[i];
10870  newData.keyErrorPlus = keyError[i];
10871  mData->insertMulti(key[i], newData);
10872  }
10873 }
10874 
10884 void QCPGraph::setDataKeyError(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value, const QVector<double> &keyErrorMinus, const QVector<double> &keyErrorPlus)
10885 {
10886  mData->clear();
10887  int n = key.size();
10888  n = qMin(n, value.size());
10889  n = qMin(n, keyErrorMinus.size());
10890  n = qMin(n, keyErrorPlus.size());
10891  QCPData newData;
10892  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
10893  {
10894  newData.key = key[i];
10895  newData.value = value[i];
10896  newData.keyErrorMinus = keyErrorMinus[i];
10897  newData.keyErrorPlus = keyErrorPlus[i];
10898  mData->insertMulti(key[i], newData);
10899  }
10900 }
10901 
10911 void QCPGraph::setDataBothError(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value, const QVector<double> &keyError, const QVector<double> &valueError)
10912 {
10913  mData->clear();
10914  int n = key.size();
10915  n = qMin(n, value.size());
10916  n = qMin(n, valueError.size());
10917  n = qMin(n, keyError.size());
10918  QCPData newData;
10919  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
10920  {
10921  newData.key = key[i];
10922  newData.value = value[i];
10923  newData.keyErrorMinus = keyError[i];
10924  newData.keyErrorPlus = keyError[i];
10925  newData.valueErrorMinus = valueError[i];
10926  newData.valueErrorPlus = valueError[i];
10927  mData->insertMulti(key[i], newData);
10928  }
10929 }
10930 
10940 void QCPGraph::setDataBothError(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value, const QVector<double> &keyErrorMinus, const QVector<double> &keyErrorPlus, const QVector<double> &valueErrorMinus, const QVector<double> &valueErrorPlus)
10941 {
10942  mData->clear();
10943  int n = key.size();
10944  n = qMin(n, value.size());
10945  n = qMin(n, valueErrorMinus.size());
10946  n = qMin(n, valueErrorPlus.size());
10947  n = qMin(n, keyErrorMinus.size());
10948  n = qMin(n, keyErrorPlus.size());
10949  QCPData newData;
10950  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
10951  {
10952  newData.key = key[i];
10953  newData.value = value[i];
10954  newData.keyErrorMinus = keyErrorMinus[i];
10955  newData.keyErrorPlus = keyErrorPlus[i];
10956  newData.valueErrorMinus = valueErrorMinus[i];
10957  newData.valueErrorPlus = valueErrorPlus[i];
10958  mData->insertMulti(key[i], newData);
10959  }
10960 }
10961 
10962 
10969 void QCPGraph::setLineStyle(LineStyle ls)
10970 {
10971  mLineStyle = ls;
10972 }
10973 
10980 void QCPGraph::setScatterStyle(const QCPScatterStyle &style)
10981 {
10982  mScatterStyle = style;
10983 }
10984 
10993 void QCPGraph::setErrorType(ErrorType errorType)
10994 {
10995  mErrorType = errorType;
10996 }
10997 
11002 void QCPGraph::setErrorPen(const QPen &pen)
11003 {
11004  mErrorPen = pen;
11005 }
11006 
11010 void QCPGraph::setErrorBarSize(double size)
11011 {
11012  mErrorBarSize = size;
11013 }
11014 
11026 void QCPGraph::setErrorBarSkipSymbol(bool enabled)
11027 {
11028  mErrorBarSkipSymbol = enabled;
11029 }
11030 
11040 void QCPGraph::setChannelFillGraph(QCPGraph *targetGraph)
11041 {
11042  // prevent setting channel target to this graph itself:
11043  if (targetGraph == this)
11044  {
11045  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "targetGraph is this graph itself";
11046  mChannelFillGraph.clear();
11047  return;
11048  }
11049  // prevent setting channel target to a graph not in the plot:
11050  if (targetGraph && targetGraph->mParentPlot != mParentPlot)
11051  {
11052  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "targetGraph not in same plot";
11053  mChannelFillGraph.clear();
11054  return;
11055  }
11056 
11057  mChannelFillGraph = targetGraph;
11058 }
11059 
11064 void QCPGraph::addData(const QCPDataMap &dataMap)
11065 {
11066  mData->unite(dataMap);
11067 }
11068 
11073 void QCPGraph::addData(const QCPData &data)
11074 {
11075  mData->insertMulti(data.key, data);
11076 }
11077 
11082 void QCPGraph::addData(double key, double value)
11083 {
11084  QCPData newData;
11085  newData.key = key;
11086  newData.value = value;
11087  mData->insertMulti(newData.key, newData);
11088 }
11089 
11094 void QCPGraph::addData(const QVector<double> &keys, const QVector<double> &values)
11095 {
11096  int n = qMin(keys.size(), values.size());
11097  QCPData newData;
11098  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
11099  {
11100  newData.key = keys[i];
11101  newData.value = values[i];
11102  mData->insertMulti(newData.key, newData);
11103  }
11104 }
11105 
11110 void QCPGraph::removeDataBefore(double key)
11111 {
11112  QCPDataMap::iterator it = mData->begin();
11113  while (it != mData->end() && it.key() < key)
11114  it = mData->erase(it);
11115 }
11116 
11121 void QCPGraph::removeDataAfter(double key)
11122 {
11123  if (mData->isEmpty()) return;
11124  QCPDataMap::iterator it = mData->upperBound(key);
11125  while (it != mData->end())
11126  it = mData->erase(it);
11127 }
11128 
11136 void QCPGraph::removeData(double fromKey, double toKey)
11137 {
11138  if (fromKey >= toKey || mData->isEmpty()) return;
11139  QCPDataMap::iterator it = mData->upperBound(fromKey);
11140  QCPDataMap::iterator itEnd = mData->upperBound(toKey);
11141  while (it != itEnd)
11142  it = mData->erase(it);
11143 }
11144 
11153 void QCPGraph::removeData(double key)
11154 {
11155  mData->remove(key);
11156 }
11157 
11162 void QCPGraph::clearData()
11163 {
11164  mData->clear();
11165 }
11166 
11167 /* inherits documentation from base class */
11168 double QCPGraph::selectTest(const QPointF &pos, bool onlySelectable, QVariant *details) const
11169 {
11170  Q_UNUSED(details)
11171  if ((onlySelectable && !mSelectable) || mData->isEmpty())
11172  return -1;
11173 
11174  return pointDistance(pos);
11175 }
11176 
11184 void QCPGraph::rescaleAxes(bool onlyEnlarge, bool includeErrorBars) const
11185 {
11186  rescaleKeyAxis(onlyEnlarge, includeErrorBars);
11187  rescaleValueAxis(onlyEnlarge, includeErrorBars);
11188 }
11189 
11197 void QCPGraph::rescaleKeyAxis(bool onlyEnlarge, bool includeErrorBars) const
11198 {
11199  // this code is a copy of QCPAbstractPlottable::rescaleKeyAxis with the only change
11200  // that getKeyRange is passed the includeErrorBars value.
11201  if (mData->isEmpty()) return;
11202 
11203  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
11204  if (!keyAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key axis"; return; }
11205 
11206  SignDomain signDomain = sdBoth;
11207  if (keyAxis->scaleType() == QCPAxis::stLogarithmic)
11208  signDomain = (keyAxis->range().upper < 0 ? sdNegative : sdPositive);
11209 
11210  bool validRange;
11211  QCPRange newRange = getKeyRange(validRange, signDomain, includeErrorBars);
11212 
11213  if (validRange)
11214  {
11215  if (onlyEnlarge)
11216  {
11217  if (keyAxis->range().lower < newRange.lower)
11218  newRange.lower = keyAxis->range().lower;
11219  if (keyAxis->range().upper > newRange.upper)
11220  newRange.upper = keyAxis->range().upper;
11221  }
11222  keyAxis->setRange(newRange);
11223  }
11224 }
11225 
11233 void QCPGraph::rescaleValueAxis(bool onlyEnlarge, bool includeErrorBars) const
11234 {
11235  // this code is a copy of QCPAbstractPlottable::rescaleValueAxis with the only change
11236  // is that getValueRange is passed the includeErrorBars value.
11237  if (mData->isEmpty()) return;
11238 
11239  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
11240  if (!valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid value axis"; return; }
11241 
11242  SignDomain signDomain = sdBoth;
11243  if (valueAxis->scaleType() == QCPAxis::stLogarithmic)
11244  signDomain = (valueAxis->range().upper < 0 ? sdNegative : sdPositive);
11245 
11246  bool validRange;
11247  QCPRange newRange = getValueRange(validRange, signDomain, includeErrorBars);
11248 
11249  if (validRange)
11250  {
11251  if (onlyEnlarge)
11252  {
11253  if (valueAxis->range().lower < newRange.lower)
11254  newRange.lower = valueAxis->range().lower;
11255  if (valueAxis->range().upper > newRange.upper)
11256  newRange.upper = valueAxis->range().upper;
11257  }
11258  valueAxis->setRange(newRange);
11259  }
11260 }
11261 
11262 /* inherits documentation from base class */
11263 void QCPGraph::draw(QCPPainter *painter)
11264 {
11265  if (!mKeyAxis || !mValueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
11266  if (mKeyAxis.data()->range().size() <= 0 || mData->isEmpty()) return;
11267  if (mLineStyle == lsNone && mScatterStyle.isNone()) return;
11268 
11269  // allocate line and (if necessary) point vectors:
11270  QVector<QPointF> *lineData = new QVector<QPointF>;
11271  QVector<QCPData> *pointData = 0;
11272  if (!mScatterStyle.isNone())
11273  pointData = new QVector<QCPData>;
11274 
11275  // fill vectors with data appropriate to plot style:
11276  getPlotData(lineData, pointData);
11277 
11278  // check data validity if flag set:
11279 #ifdef QCUSTOMPLOT_CHECK_DATA
11280  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it;
11281  for (it = mData->constBegin(); it != mData->constEnd(); ++it)
11282  {
11283  if (QCP::isInvalidData(it.value().key, it.value().value) ||
11284  QCP::isInvalidData(it.value().keyErrorPlus, it.value().keyErrorMinus) ||
11285  QCP::isInvalidData(it.value().valueErrorPlus, it.value().valueErrorPlus))
11286  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "Data point at" << it.key() << "invalid." << "Plottable name:" << name();
11287  }
11288 #endif
11289 
11290  // draw fill of graph:
11291  drawFill(painter, lineData);
11292 
11293  // draw line:
11294  if (mLineStyle == lsImpulse)
11295  drawImpulsePlot(painter, lineData);
11296  else if (mLineStyle != lsNone)
11297  drawLinePlot(painter, lineData); // also step plots can be drawn as a line plot
11298 
11299  // draw scatters:
11300  if (pointData)
11301  drawScatterPlot(painter, pointData);
11302 
11303  // free allocated line and point vectors:
11304  delete lineData;
11305  if (pointData)
11306  delete pointData;
11307 }
11308 
11309 /* inherits documentation from base class */
11310 void QCPGraph::drawLegendIcon(QCPPainter *painter, const QRectF &rect) const
11311 {
11312  // draw fill:
11313  if (mBrush.style() != Qt::NoBrush)
11314  {
11315  applyFillAntialiasingHint(painter);
11316  painter->fillRect(QRectF(rect.left(), rect.top()+rect.height()/2.0, rect.width(), rect.height()/3.0), mBrush);
11317  }
11318  // draw line vertically centered:
11319  if (mLineStyle != lsNone)
11320  {
11321  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
11322  painter->setPen(mPen);
11323  painter->drawLine(QLineF(rect.left(), rect.top()+rect.height()/2.0, rect.right()+5, rect.top()+rect.height()/2.0)); // +5 on x2 else last segment is missing from dashed/dotted pens
11324  }
11325  // draw scatter symbol:
11326  if (!mScatterStyle.isNone())
11327  {
11328  applyScattersAntialiasingHint(painter);
11329  // scale scatter pixmap if it's too large to fit in legend icon rect:
11330  if (mScatterStyle.shape() == QCPScatterStyle::ssPixmap && (mScatterStyle.pixmap().size().width() > rect.width() || mScatterStyle.pixmap().size().height() > rect.height()))
11331  {
11332  QCPScatterStyle scaledStyle(mScatterStyle);
11333  scaledStyle.setPixmap(scaledStyle.pixmap().scaled(rect.size().toSize(), Qt::KeepAspectRatio, Qt::SmoothTransformation));
11334  scaledStyle.applyTo(painter, mPen);
11335  scaledStyle.drawShape(painter, QRectF(rect).center());
11336  } else
11337  {
11338  mScatterStyle.applyTo(painter, mPen);
11339  mScatterStyle.drawShape(painter, QRectF(rect).center());
11340  }
11341  }
11342 }
11343 
11362 void QCPGraph::getPlotData(QVector<QPointF> *lineData, QVector<QCPData> *pointData) const
11363 {
11364  switch(mLineStyle)
11365  {
11366  case lsNone: getScatterPlotData(pointData); break;
11367  case lsLine: getLinePlotData(lineData, pointData); break;
11368  case lsStepLeft: getStepLeftPlotData(lineData, pointData); break;
11369  case lsStepRight: getStepRightPlotData(lineData, pointData); break;
11370  case lsStepCenter: getStepCenterPlotData(lineData, pointData); break;
11371  case lsImpulse: getImpulsePlotData(lineData, pointData); break;
11372  }
11373 }
11374 
11386 void QCPGraph::getScatterPlotData(QVector<QCPData> *pointData) const
11387 {
11388  if (!pointData) return;
11389  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
11390  if (!keyAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key axis"; return; }
11391 
11392  // get visible data range:
11393  QCPDataMap::const_iterator lower, upper;
11394  int dataCount = 0;
11395  getVisibleDataBounds(lower, upper, dataCount);
11396  if (dataCount > 0)
11397  {
11398  // prepare vectors:
11399  pointData->resize(dataCount);
11400 
11401  // position data points:
11402  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = lower;
11403  QCPDataMap::const_iterator upperEnd = upper+1;
11404  int i = 0;
11405  while (it != upperEnd)
11406  {
11407  (*pointData)[i] = it.value();
11408  ++i;
11409  ++it;
11410  }
11411  }
11412 }
11413 
11425 void QCPGraph::getLinePlotData(QVector<QPointF> *lineData, QVector<QCPData> *pointData) const
11426 {
11427  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
11428  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
11429  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
11430  if (!lineData) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "null pointer passed as lineData"; return; }
11431 
11432  // get visible data range:
11433  QCPDataMap::const_iterator lower, upper;
11434  int dataCount = 0;
11435  getVisibleDataBounds(lower, upper, dataCount);
11436  if (dataCount > 0)
11437  {
11438  lineData->reserve(dataCount+2); // added 2 to reserve memory for lower/upper fill base points that might be needed for fill
11439  lineData->resize(dataCount);
11440  if (pointData)
11441  pointData->resize(dataCount);
11442 
11443  // position data points:
11444  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = lower;
11445  QCPDataMap::const_iterator upperEnd = upper+1;
11446  int i = 0;
11447  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
11448  {
11449  while (it != upperEnd)
11450  {
11451  if (pointData)
11452  (*pointData)[i] = it.value();
11453  (*lineData)[i].setX(valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value));
11454  (*lineData)[i].setY(keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key()));
11455  ++i;
11456  ++it;
11457  }
11458  } else // key axis is horizontal
11459  {
11460  while (it != upperEnd)
11461  {
11462  if (pointData)
11463  (*pointData)[i] = it.value();
11464  (*lineData)[i].setX(keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key()));
11465  (*lineData)[i].setY(valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value));
11466  ++i;
11467  ++it;
11468  }
11469  }
11470  }
11471 }
11472 
11484 void QCPGraph::getStepLeftPlotData(QVector<QPointF> *lineData, QVector<QCPData> *pointData) const
11485 {
11486  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
11487  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
11488  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
11489  if (!lineData) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "null pointer passed as lineData"; return; }
11490 
11491  // get visible data range:
11492  QCPDataMap::const_iterator lower, upper;
11493  int dataCount = 0;
11494  getVisibleDataBounds(lower, upper, dataCount);
11495  if (dataCount > 0)
11496  {
11497  lineData->reserve(dataCount*2+2); // added 2 to reserve memory for lower/upper fill base points that might be needed for fill
11498  lineData->resize(dataCount*2); // multiplied by 2 because step plot needs two polyline points per one actual data point
11499  if (pointData)
11500  pointData->resize(dataCount);
11501 
11502  // position data points:
11503  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = lower;
11504  QCPDataMap::const_iterator upperEnd = upper+1;
11505  int i = 0;
11506  int ipoint = 0;
11507  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
11508  {
11509  double lastValue = valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
11510  double key;
11511  while (it != upperEnd)
11512  {
11513  if (pointData)
11514  {
11515  (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
11516  ++ipoint;
11517  }
11518  key = keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
11519  (*lineData)[i].setX(lastValue);
11520  (*lineData)[i].setY(key);
11521  ++i;
11522  lastValue = valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
11523  (*lineData)[i].setX(lastValue);
11524  (*lineData)[i].setY(key);
11525  ++i;
11526  ++it;
11527  }
11528  } else // key axis is horizontal
11529  {
11530  double lastValue = valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
11531  double key;
11532  while (it != upperEnd)
11533  {
11534  if (pointData)
11535  {
11536  (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
11537  ++ipoint;
11538  }
11539  key = keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
11540  (*lineData)[i].setX(key);
11541  (*lineData)[i].setY(lastValue);
11542  ++i;
11543  lastValue = valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
11544  (*lineData)[i].setX(key);
11545  (*lineData)[i].setY(lastValue);
11546  ++i;
11547  ++it;
11548  }
11549  }
11550  }
11551 }
11552 
11564 void QCPGraph::getStepRightPlotData(QVector<QPointF> *lineData, QVector<QCPData> *pointData) const
11565 {
11566  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
11567  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
11568  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
11569  if (!lineData) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "null pointer passed as lineData"; return; }
11570 
11571  // get visible data range:
11572  QCPDataMap::const_iterator lower, upper;
11573  int dataCount = 0;
11574  getVisibleDataBounds(lower, upper, dataCount);
11575  if (dataCount > 0)
11576  {
11577  lineData->reserve(dataCount*2+2); // added 2 to reserve memory for lower/upper fill base points that might be needed for fill
11578  lineData->resize(dataCount*2); // multiplied by 2 because step plot needs two polyline points per one actual data point
11579  if (pointData)
11580  pointData->resize(dataCount);
11581 
11582  // position points:
11583  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = lower;
11584  QCPDataMap::const_iterator upperEnd = upper+1;
11585  int i = 0;
11586  int ipoint = 0;
11587  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
11588  {
11589  double lastKey = keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
11590  double value;
11591  while (it != upperEnd)
11592  {
11593  if (pointData)
11594  {
11595  (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
11596  ++ipoint;
11597  }
11598  value = valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
11599  (*lineData)[i].setX(value);
11600  (*lineData)[i].setY(lastKey);
11601  ++i;
11602  lastKey = keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
11603  (*lineData)[i].setX(value);
11604  (*lineData)[i].setY(lastKey);
11605  ++i;
11606  ++it;
11607  }
11608  } else // key axis is horizontal
11609  {
11610  double lastKey = keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
11611  double value;
11612  while (it != upperEnd)
11613  {
11614  if (pointData)
11615  {
11616  (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
11617  ++ipoint;
11618  }
11619  value = valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
11620  (*lineData)[i].setX(lastKey);
11621  (*lineData)[i].setY(value);
11622  ++i;
11623  lastKey = keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
11624  (*lineData)[i].setX(lastKey);
11625  (*lineData)[i].setY(value);
11626  ++i;
11627  ++it;
11628  }
11629  }
11630  }
11631 }
11632 
11644 void QCPGraph::getStepCenterPlotData(QVector<QPointF> *lineData, QVector<QCPData> *pointData) const
11645 {
11646  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
11647  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
11648  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
11649  if (!lineData) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "null pointer passed as lineData"; return; }
11650 
11651  // get visible data range:
11652  QCPDataMap::const_iterator lower, upper;
11653  int dataCount = 0;
11654  getVisibleDataBounds(lower, upper, dataCount);
11655  if (dataCount > 0)
11656  {
11657  // added 2 to reserve memory for lower/upper fill base points that might be needed for base fill
11658  // multiplied by 2 because step plot needs two polyline points per one actual data point
11659  lineData->reserve(dataCount*2+2);
11660  lineData->resize(dataCount*2);
11661  if (pointData)
11662  pointData->resize(dataCount);
11663 
11664  // position points:
11665  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = lower;
11666  QCPDataMap::const_iterator upperEnd = upper+1;
11667  int i = 0;
11668  int ipoint = 0;
11669  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
11670  {
11671  double lastKey = keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
11672  double lastValue = valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
11673  double key;
11674  if (pointData)
11675  {
11676  (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
11677  ++ipoint;
11678  }
11679  (*lineData)[i].setX(lastValue);
11680  (*lineData)[i].setY(lastKey);
11681  ++it;
11682  ++i;
11683  while (it != upperEnd)
11684  {
11685  if (pointData)
11686  {
11687  (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
11688  ++ipoint;
11689  }
11690  key = (keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key())-lastKey)*0.5 + lastKey;
11691  (*lineData)[i].setX(lastValue);
11692  (*lineData)[i].setY(key);
11693  ++i;
11694  lastValue = valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
11695  lastKey = keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
11696  (*lineData)[i].setX(lastValue);
11697  (*lineData)[i].setY(key);
11698  ++it;
11699  ++i;
11700  }
11701  (*lineData)[i].setX(lastValue);
11702  (*lineData)[i].setY(lastKey);
11703  } else // key axis is horizontal
11704  {
11705  double lastKey = keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
11706  double lastValue = valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
11707  double key;
11708  if (pointData)
11709  {
11710  (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
11711  ++ipoint;
11712  }
11713  (*lineData)[i].setX(lastKey);
11714  (*lineData)[i].setY(lastValue);
11715  ++it;
11716  ++i;
11717  while (it != upperEnd)
11718  {
11719  if (pointData)
11720  {
11721  (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
11722  ++ipoint;
11723  }
11724  key = (keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key())-lastKey)*0.5 + lastKey;
11725  (*lineData)[i].setX(key);
11726  (*lineData)[i].setY(lastValue);
11727  ++i;
11728  lastValue = valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
11729  lastKey = keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
11730  (*lineData)[i].setX(key);
11731  (*lineData)[i].setY(lastValue);
11732  ++it;
11733  ++i;
11734  }
11735  (*lineData)[i].setX(lastKey);
11736  (*lineData)[i].setY(lastValue);
11737  }
11738  }
11739 }
11740 
11752 void QCPGraph::getImpulsePlotData(QVector<QPointF> *lineData, QVector<QCPData> *pointData) const
11753 {
11754  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
11755  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
11756  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
11757  if (!lineData) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "null pointer passed as lineData"; return; }
11758 
11759  // get visible data range:
11760  QCPDataMap::const_iterator lower, upper;
11761  int dataCount = 0;
11762  getVisibleDataBounds(lower, upper, dataCount);
11763  if (dataCount > 0)
11764  {
11765  lineData->resize(dataCount*2); // no need to reserve 2 extra points, because there is no fill for impulse plot
11766  if (pointData)
11767  pointData->resize(dataCount);
11768 
11769  // position data points:
11770  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = lower;
11771  QCPDataMap::const_iterator upperEnd = upper+1;
11772  int i = 0;
11773  int ipoint = 0;
11774  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
11775  {
11776  double zeroPointX = valueAxis->coordToPixel(0);
11777  double key;
11778  while (it != upperEnd)
11779  {
11780  if (pointData)
11781  {
11782  (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
11783  ++ipoint;
11784  }
11785  key = keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
11786  (*lineData)[i].setX(zeroPointX);
11787  (*lineData)[i].setY(key);
11788  ++i;
11789  (*lineData)[i].setX(valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value));
11790  (*lineData)[i].setY(key);
11791  ++i;
11792  ++it;
11793  }
11794  } else // key axis is horizontal
11795  {
11796  double zeroPointY = valueAxis->coordToPixel(0);
11797  double key;
11798  while (it != upperEnd)
11799  {
11800  if (pointData)
11801  {
11802  (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
11803  ++ipoint;
11804  }
11805  key = keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
11806  (*lineData)[i].setX(key);
11807  (*lineData)[i].setY(zeroPointY);
11808  ++i;
11809  (*lineData)[i].setX(key);
11810  (*lineData)[i].setY(valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value));
11811  ++i;
11812  ++it;
11813  }
11814  }
11815  }
11816 }
11817 
11831 void QCPGraph::drawFill(QCPPainter *painter, QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const
11832 {
11833  if (mLineStyle == lsImpulse) return; // fill doesn't make sense for impulse plot
11834  if (mainBrush().style() == Qt::NoBrush || mainBrush().color().alpha() == 0) return;
11835 
11836  applyFillAntialiasingHint(painter);
11837  if (!mChannelFillGraph)
11838  {
11839  // draw base fill under graph, fill goes all the way to the zero-value-line:
11840  addFillBasePoints(lineData);
11841  painter->setPen(Qt::NoPen);
11842  painter->setBrush(mainBrush());
11843  painter->drawPolygon(QPolygonF(*lineData));
11844  removeFillBasePoints(lineData);
11845  } else
11846  {
11847  // draw channel fill between this graph and mChannelFillGraph:
11848  painter->setPen(Qt::NoPen);
11849  painter->setBrush(mainBrush());
11850  painter->drawPolygon(getChannelFillPolygon(lineData));
11851  }
11852 }
11853 
11863 void QCPGraph::drawScatterPlot(QCPPainter *painter, QVector<QCPData> *pointData) const
11864 {
11865  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
11866  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
11867  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
11868 
11869  // draw error bars:
11870  if (mErrorType != etNone)
11871  {
11872  applyErrorBarsAntialiasingHint(painter);
11873  painter->setPen(mErrorPen);
11874  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
11875  {
11876  for (int i=0; i<pointData->size(); ++i)
11877  drawError(painter, valueAxis->coordToPixel(pointData->at(i).value), keyAxis->coordToPixel(pointData->at(i).key), pointData->at(i));
11878  } else
11879  {
11880  for (int i=0; i<pointData->size(); ++i)
11881  drawError(painter, keyAxis->coordToPixel(pointData->at(i).key), valueAxis->coordToPixel(pointData->at(i).value), pointData->at(i));
11882  }
11883  }
11884 
11885  // draw scatter point symbols:
11886  applyScattersAntialiasingHint(painter);
11887  mScatterStyle.applyTo(painter, mPen);
11888  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
11889  {
11890  for (int i=0; i<pointData->size(); ++i)
11891  mScatterStyle.drawShape(painter, valueAxis->coordToPixel(pointData->at(i).value), keyAxis->coordToPixel(pointData->at(i).key));
11892  } else
11893  {
11894  for (int i=0; i<pointData->size(); ++i)
11895  mScatterStyle.drawShape(painter, keyAxis->coordToPixel(pointData->at(i).key), valueAxis->coordToPixel(pointData->at(i).value));
11896  }
11897 }
11898 
11908 void QCPGraph::drawLinePlot(QCPPainter *painter, QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const
11909 {
11910  // draw line of graph:
11911  if (mainPen().style() != Qt::NoPen && mainPen().color().alpha() != 0)
11912  {
11913  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
11914  painter->setPen(mainPen());
11915  painter->setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
11916 
11917  /* Draws polyline in batches, currently not used:
11918  int p = 0;
11919  while (p < lineData->size())
11920  {
11921  int batch = qMin(25, lineData->size()-p);
11922  if (p != 0)
11923  {
11924  ++batch;
11925  --p; // to draw the connection lines between two batches
11926  }
11927  painter->drawPolyline(lineData->constData()+p, batch);
11928  p += batch;
11929  }
11930  */
11931 
11932  // if drawing solid line and not in PDF, use much faster line drawing instead of polyline:
11933  if (mParentPlot->plottingHints().testFlag(QCP::phFastPolylines) &&
11934  painter->pen().style() == Qt::SolidLine &&
11935  !painter->modes().testFlag(QCPPainter::pmVectorized)&&
11936  !painter->modes().testFlag(QCPPainter::pmNoCaching))
11937  {
11938  for (int i=1; i<lineData->size(); ++i)
11939  painter->drawLine(lineData->at(i-1), lineData->at(i));
11940  } else
11941  {
11942  painter->drawPolyline(QPolygonF(*lineData));
11943  }
11944  }
11945 }
11946 
11954 void QCPGraph::drawImpulsePlot(QCPPainter *painter, QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const
11955 {
11956  // draw impulses:
11957  if (mainPen().style() != Qt::NoPen && mainPen().color().alpha() != 0)
11958  {
11959  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
11960  QPen pen = mainPen();
11961  pen.setCapStyle(Qt::FlatCap); // so impulse line doesn't reach beyond zero-line
11962  painter->setPen(pen);
11963  painter->setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
11964  painter->drawLines(*lineData);
11965  }
11966 }
11967 
11975 void QCPGraph::drawError(QCPPainter *painter, double x, double y, const QCPData &data) const
11976 {
11977  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
11978  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
11979  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
11980 
11981  double a, b; // positions of error bar bounds in pixels
11982  double barWidthHalf = mErrorBarSize*0.5;
11983  double skipSymbolMargin = mScatterStyle.size(); // pixels left blank per side, when mErrorBarSkipSymbol is true
11984 
11985  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
11986  {
11987  // draw key error vertically and value error horizontally
11988  if (mErrorType == etKey || mErrorType == etBoth)
11989  {
11990  a = keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.key-data.keyErrorMinus);
11991  b = keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.key+data.keyErrorPlus);
11992  if (keyAxis->rangeReversed())
11993  qSwap(a,b);
11994  // draw spine:
11995  if (mErrorBarSkipSymbol)
11996  {
11997  if (a-y > skipSymbolMargin) // don't draw spine if error is so small it's within skipSymbolmargin
11998  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x, a, x, y+skipSymbolMargin));
11999  if (y-b > skipSymbolMargin)
12000  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x, y-skipSymbolMargin, x, b));
12001  } else
12002  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x, a, x, b));
12003  // draw handles:
12004  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x-barWidthHalf, a, x+barWidthHalf, a));
12005  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x-barWidthHalf, b, x+barWidthHalf, b));
12006  }
12007  if (mErrorType == etValue || mErrorType == etBoth)
12008  {
12009  a = valueAxis->coordToPixel(data.value-data.valueErrorMinus);
12010  b = valueAxis->coordToPixel(data.value+data.valueErrorPlus);
12011  if (valueAxis->rangeReversed())
12012  qSwap(a,b);
12013  // draw spine:
12014  if (mErrorBarSkipSymbol)
12015  {
12016  if (x-a > skipSymbolMargin) // don't draw spine if error is so small it's within skipSymbolmargin
12017  painter->drawLine(QLineF(a, y, x-skipSymbolMargin, y));
12018  if (b-x > skipSymbolMargin)
12019  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x+skipSymbolMargin, y, b, y));
12020  } else
12021  painter->drawLine(QLineF(a, y, b, y));
12022  // draw handles:
12023  painter->drawLine(QLineF(a, y-barWidthHalf, a, y+barWidthHalf));
12024  painter->drawLine(QLineF(b, y-barWidthHalf, b, y+barWidthHalf));
12025  }
12026  } else // mKeyAxis->orientation() is Qt::Horizontal
12027  {
12028  // draw value error vertically and key error horizontally
12029  if (mErrorType == etKey || mErrorType == etBoth)
12030  {
12031  a = keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.key-data.keyErrorMinus);
12032  b = keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.key+data.keyErrorPlus);
12033  if (keyAxis->rangeReversed())
12034  qSwap(a,b);
12035  // draw spine:
12036  if (mErrorBarSkipSymbol)
12037  {
12038  if (x-a > skipSymbolMargin) // don't draw spine if error is so small it's within skipSymbolmargin
12039  painter->drawLine(QLineF(a, y, x-skipSymbolMargin, y));
12040  if (b-x > skipSymbolMargin)
12041  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x+skipSymbolMargin, y, b, y));
12042  } else
12043  painter->drawLine(QLineF(a, y, b, y));
12044  // draw handles:
12045  painter->drawLine(QLineF(a, y-barWidthHalf, a, y+barWidthHalf));
12046  painter->drawLine(QLineF(b, y-barWidthHalf, b, y+barWidthHalf));
12047  }
12048  if (mErrorType == etValue || mErrorType == etBoth)
12049  {
12050  a = valueAxis->coordToPixel(data.value-data.valueErrorMinus);
12051  b = valueAxis->coordToPixel(data.value+data.valueErrorPlus);
12052  if (valueAxis->rangeReversed())
12053  qSwap(a,b);
12054  // draw spine:
12055  if (mErrorBarSkipSymbol)
12056  {
12057  if (a-y > skipSymbolMargin) // don't draw spine if error is so small it's within skipSymbolmargin
12058  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x, a, x, y+skipSymbolMargin));
12059  if (y-b > skipSymbolMargin)
12060  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x, y-skipSymbolMargin, x, b));
12061  } else
12062  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x, a, x, b));
12063  // draw handles:
12064  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x-barWidthHalf, a, x+barWidthHalf, a));
12065  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x-barWidthHalf, b, x+barWidthHalf, b));
12066  }
12067  }
12068 }
12069 
12088 void QCPGraph::getVisibleDataBounds(QCPDataMap::const_iterator &lower, QCPDataMap::const_iterator &upper, int &count) const
12089 {
12090  if (!mKeyAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key axis"; return; }
12091  if (mData->isEmpty())
12092  {
12093  lower = mData->constEnd();
12094  upper = mData->constEnd();
12095  count = 0;
12096  return;
12097  }
12098 
12099  // get visible data range as QMap iterators
12100  QCPDataMap::const_iterator lbound = mData->lowerBound(mKeyAxis.data()->range().lower);
12101  QCPDataMap::const_iterator ubound = mData->upperBound(mKeyAxis.data()->range().upper);
12102  bool lowoutlier = lbound != mData->constBegin(); // indicates whether there exist points below axis range
12103  bool highoutlier = ubound != mData->constEnd(); // indicates whether there exist points above axis range
12104 
12105  lower = (lowoutlier ? lbound-1 : lbound); // data point range that will be actually drawn
12106  upper = (highoutlier ? ubound : ubound-1); // data point range that will be actually drawn
12107 
12108  // count number of points in range lower to upper (including them), so we can allocate array for them in draw functions:
12109  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = lower;
12110  count = 1;
12111  while (it != upper)
12112  {
12113  ++it;
12114  ++count;
12115  }
12116 }
12117 
12133 void QCPGraph::addFillBasePoints(QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const
12134 {
12135  if (!mKeyAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key axis"; return; }
12136 
12137  // append points that close the polygon fill at the key axis:
12138  if (mKeyAxis.data()->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
12139  {
12140  *lineData << upperFillBasePoint(lineData->last().y());
12141  *lineData << lowerFillBasePoint(lineData->first().y());
12142  } else
12143  {
12144  *lineData << upperFillBasePoint(lineData->last().x());
12145  *lineData << lowerFillBasePoint(lineData->first().x());
12146  }
12147 }
12148 
12155 void QCPGraph::removeFillBasePoints(QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const
12156 {
12157  lineData->remove(lineData->size()-2, 2);
12158 }
12159 
12174 QPointF QCPGraph::lowerFillBasePoint(double lowerKey) const
12175 {
12176  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
12177  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
12178  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return QPointF(); }
12179 
12180  QPointF point;
12181  if (valueAxis->scaleType() == QCPAxis::stLinear)
12182  {
12183  if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atLeft)
12184  {
12185  point.setX(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
12186  point.setY(lowerKey);
12187  } else if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atRight)
12188  {
12189  point.setX(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
12190  point.setY(lowerKey);
12191  } else if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atTop)
12192  {
12193  point.setX(lowerKey);
12194  point.setY(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
12195  } else if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atBottom)
12196  {
12197  point.setX(lowerKey);
12198  point.setY(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
12199  }
12200  } else // valueAxis->mScaleType == QCPAxis::stLogarithmic
12201  {
12202  // In logarithmic scaling we can't just draw to value zero so we just fill all the way
12203  // to the axis which is in the direction towards zero
12204  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
12205  {
12206  if ((valueAxis->range().upper < 0 && !valueAxis->rangeReversed()) ||
12207  (valueAxis->range().upper > 0 && valueAxis->rangeReversed())) // if range is negative, zero is on opposite side of key axis
12208  point.setX(keyAxis->axisRect()->right());
12209  else
12210  point.setX(keyAxis->axisRect()->left());
12211  point.setY(lowerKey);
12212  } else if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atTop || keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atBottom)
12213  {
12214  point.setX(lowerKey);
12215  if ((valueAxis->range().upper < 0 && !valueAxis->rangeReversed()) ||
12216  (valueAxis->range().upper > 0 && valueAxis->rangeReversed())) // if range is negative, zero is on opposite side of key axis
12217  point.setY(keyAxis->axisRect()->top());
12218  else
12219  point.setY(keyAxis->axisRect()->bottom());
12220  }
12221  }
12222  return point;
12223 }
12224 
12239 QPointF QCPGraph::upperFillBasePoint(double upperKey) const
12240 {
12241  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
12242  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
12243  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return QPointF(); }
12244 
12245  QPointF point;
12246  if (valueAxis->scaleType() == QCPAxis::stLinear)
12247  {
12248  if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atLeft)
12249  {
12250  point.setX(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
12251  point.setY(upperKey);
12252  } else if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atRight)
12253  {
12254  point.setX(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
12255  point.setY(upperKey);
12256  } else if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atTop)
12257  {
12258  point.setX(upperKey);
12259  point.setY(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
12260  } else if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atBottom)
12261  {
12262  point.setX(upperKey);
12263  point.setY(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
12264  }
12265  } else // valueAxis->mScaleType == QCPAxis::stLogarithmic
12266  {
12267  // In logarithmic scaling we can't just draw to value 0 so we just fill all the way
12268  // to the axis which is in the direction towards 0
12269  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
12270  {
12271  if ((valueAxis->range().upper < 0 && !valueAxis->rangeReversed()) ||
12272  (valueAxis->range().upper > 0 && valueAxis->rangeReversed())) // if range is negative, zero is on opposite side of key axis
12273  point.setX(keyAxis->axisRect()->right());
12274  else
12275  point.setX(keyAxis->axisRect()->left());
12276  point.setY(upperKey);
12277  } else if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atTop || keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atBottom)
12278  {
12279  point.setX(upperKey);
12280  if ((valueAxis->range().upper < 0 && !valueAxis->rangeReversed()) ||
12281  (valueAxis->range().upper > 0 && valueAxis->rangeReversed())) // if range is negative, zero is on opposite side of key axis
12282  point.setY(keyAxis->axisRect()->top());
12283  else
12284  point.setY(keyAxis->axisRect()->bottom());
12285  }
12286  }
12287  return point;
12288 }
12289 
12299 const QPolygonF QCPGraph::getChannelFillPolygon(const QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const
12300 {
12301  if (!mChannelFillGraph)
12302  return QPolygonF();
12303 
12304  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
12305  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
12306  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return QPolygonF(); }
12307  if (!mChannelFillGraph.data()->mKeyAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "channel fill target key axis invalid"; return QPolygonF(); }
12308 
12309  if (mChannelFillGraph.data()->mKeyAxis.data()->orientation() != keyAxis->orientation())
12310  return QPolygonF(); // don't have same axis orientation, can't fill that (Note: if keyAxis fits, valueAxis will fit too, because it's always orthogonal to keyAxis)
12311 
12312  if (lineData->isEmpty()) return QPolygonF();
12313  QVector<QPointF> otherData;
12314  mChannelFillGraph.data()->getPlotData(&otherData, 0);
12315  if (otherData.isEmpty()) return QPolygonF();
12316  QVector<QPointF> thisData;
12317  thisData.reserve(lineData->size()+otherData.size()); // because we will join both vectors at end of this function
12318  for (int i=0; i<lineData->size(); ++i) // don't use the vector<<(vector), it squeezes internally, which ruins the performance tuning with reserve()
12319  thisData << lineData->at(i);
12320 
12321  // pointers to be able to swap them, depending which data range needs cropping:
12322  QVector<QPointF> *staticData = &thisData;
12323  QVector<QPointF> *croppedData = &otherData;
12324 
12325  // crop both vectors to ranges in which the keys overlap (which coord is key, depends on axisType):
12326  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal)
12327  {
12328  // x is key
12329  // if an axis range is reversed, the data point keys will be descending. Reverse them, since following algorithm assumes ascending keys:
12330  if (staticData->first().x() > staticData->last().x())
12331  {
12332  int size = staticData->size();
12333  for (int i=0; i<size/2; ++i)
12334  qSwap((*staticData)[i], (*staticData)[size-1-i]);
12335  }
12336  if (croppedData->first().x() > croppedData->last().x())
12337  {
12338  int size = croppedData->size();
12339  for (int i=0; i<size/2; ++i)
12340  qSwap((*croppedData)[i], (*croppedData)[size-1-i]);
12341  }
12342  // crop lower bound:
12343  if (staticData->first().x() < croppedData->first().x()) // other one must be cropped
12344  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
12345  int lowBound = findIndexBelowX(croppedData, staticData->first().x());
12346  if (lowBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
12347  croppedData->remove(0, lowBound);
12348  // set lowest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of first static data
12349  // point via linear interpolation:
12350  if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
12351  double slope;
12352  if (croppedData->at(1).x()-croppedData->at(0).x() != 0)
12353  slope = (croppedData->at(1).y()-croppedData->at(0).y())/(croppedData->at(1).x()-croppedData->at(0).x());
12354  else
12355  slope = 0;
12356  (*croppedData)[0].setY(croppedData->at(0).y()+slope*(staticData->first().x()-croppedData->at(0).x()));
12357  (*croppedData)[0].setX(staticData->first().x());
12358 
12359  // crop upper bound:
12360  if (staticData->last().x() > croppedData->last().x()) // other one must be cropped
12361  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
12362  int highBound = findIndexAboveX(croppedData, staticData->last().x());
12363  if (highBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
12364  croppedData->remove(highBound+1, croppedData->size()-(highBound+1));
12365  // set highest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of last static data
12366  // point via linear interpolation:
12367  if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
12368  int li = croppedData->size()-1; // last index
12369  if (croppedData->at(li).x()-croppedData->at(li-1).x() != 0)
