12370  slope = (croppedData->at(li).y()-croppedData->at(li-1).y())/(croppedData->at(li).x()-croppedData->at(li-1).x());
12371  else
12372  slope = 0;
12373  (*croppedData)[li].setY(croppedData->at(li-1).y()+slope*(staticData->last().x()-croppedData->at(li-1).x()));
12374  (*croppedData)[li].setX(staticData->last().x());
12375  } else // mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical
12376  {
12377  // y is key
12378  // similar to "x is key" but switched x,y. Further, lower/upper meaning is inverted compared to x,
12379  // because in pixel coordinates, y increases from top to bottom, not bottom to top like data coordinate.
12380  // if an axis range is reversed, the data point keys will be descending. Reverse them, since following algorithm assumes ascending keys:
12381  if (staticData->first().y() < staticData->last().y())
12382  {
12383  int size = staticData->size();
12384  for (int i=0; i<size/2; ++i)
12385  qSwap((*staticData)[i], (*staticData)[size-1-i]);
12386  }
12387  if (croppedData->first().y() < croppedData->last().y())
12388  {
12389  int size = croppedData->size();
12390  for (int i=0; i<size/2; ++i)
12391  qSwap((*croppedData)[i], (*croppedData)[size-1-i]);
12392  }
12393  // crop lower bound:
12394  if (staticData->first().y() > croppedData->first().y()) // other one must be cropped
12395  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
12396  int lowBound = findIndexAboveY(croppedData, staticData->first().y());
12397  if (lowBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
12398  croppedData->remove(0, lowBound);
12399  // set lowest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of first static data
12400  // point via linear interpolation:
12401  if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
12402  double slope;
12403  if (croppedData->at(1).y()-croppedData->at(0).y() != 0) // avoid division by zero in step plots
12404  slope = (croppedData->at(1).x()-croppedData->at(0).x())/(croppedData->at(1).y()-croppedData->at(0).y());
12405  else
12406  slope = 0;
12407  (*croppedData)[0].setX(croppedData->at(0).x()+slope*(staticData->first().y()-croppedData->at(0).y()));
12408  (*croppedData)[0].setY(staticData->first().y());
12409 
12410  // crop upper bound:
12411  if (staticData->last().y() < croppedData->last().y()) // other one must be cropped
12412  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
12413  int highBound = findIndexBelowY(croppedData, staticData->last().y());
12414  if (highBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
12415  croppedData->remove(highBound+1, croppedData->size()-(highBound+1));
12416  // set highest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of last static data
12417  // point via linear interpolation:
12418  if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
12419  int li = croppedData->size()-1; // last index
12420  if (croppedData->at(li).y()-croppedData->at(li-1).y() != 0) // avoid division by zero in step plots
12421  slope = (croppedData->at(li).x()-croppedData->at(li-1).x())/(croppedData->at(li).y()-croppedData->at(li-1).y());
12422  else
12423  slope = 0;
12424  (*croppedData)[li].setX(croppedData->at(li-1).x()+slope*(staticData->last().y()-croppedData->at(li-1).y()));
12425  (*croppedData)[li].setY(staticData->last().y());
12426  }
12427 
12428  // return joined:
12429  for (int i=otherData.size()-1; i>=0; --i) // insert reversed, otherwise the polygon will be twisted
12430  thisData << otherData.at(i);
12431  return QPolygonF(thisData);
12432 }
12433 
12441 int QCPGraph::findIndexAboveX(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double x) const
12442 {
12443  for (int i=data->size()-1; i>=0; --i)
12444  {
12445  if (data->at(i).x() < x)
12446  {
12447  if (i<data->size()-1)
12448  return i+1;
12449  else
12450  return data->size()-1;
12451  }
12452  }
12453  return -1;
12454 }
12455 
12463 int QCPGraph::findIndexBelowX(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double x) const
12464 {
12465  for (int i=0; i<data->size(); ++i)
12466  {
12467  if (data->at(i).x() > x)
12468  {
12469  if (i>0)
12470  return i-1;
12471  else
12472  return 0;
12473  }
12474  }
12475  return -1;
12476 }
12477 
12485 int QCPGraph::findIndexAboveY(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double y) const
12486 {
12487  for (int i=0; i<data->size(); ++i)
12488  {
12489  if (data->at(i).y() < y)
12490  {
12491  if (i>0)
12492  return i-1;
12493  else
12494  return 0;
12495  }
12496  }
12497  return -1;
12498 }
12499 
12510 double QCPGraph::pointDistance(const QPointF &pixelPoint) const
12511 {
12512  if (mData->isEmpty())
12513  {
12514  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "requested point distance on graph" << mName << "without data";
12515  return 500;
12516  }
12517  if (mData->size() == 1)
12518  {
12519  QPointF dataPoint = coordsToPixels(mData->constBegin().key(), mData->constBegin().value().value);
12520  return QVector2D(dataPoint-pixelPoint).length();
12521  }
12522 
12523  if (mLineStyle == lsNone && mScatterStyle.isNone())
12524  return 500;
12525 
12526  // calculate minimum distances to graph representation:
12527  if (mLineStyle == lsNone)
12528  {
12529  // no line displayed, only calculate distance to scatter points:
12530  QVector<QCPData> *pointData = new QVector<QCPData>;
12531  getScatterPlotData(pointData);
12532  double minDistSqr = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
12533  QPointF ptA;
12534  QPointF ptB = coordsToPixels(pointData->at(0).key, pointData->at(0).value); // getScatterPlotData returns in plot coordinates, so transform to pixels
12535  for (int i=1; i<pointData->size(); ++i)
12536  {
12537  ptA = ptB;
12538  ptB = coordsToPixels(pointData->at(i).key, pointData->at(i).value);
12539  double currentDistSqr = distSqrToLine(ptA, ptB, pixelPoint);
12540  if (currentDistSqr < minDistSqr)
12541  minDistSqr = currentDistSqr;
12542  }
12543  delete pointData;
12544  return sqrt(minDistSqr);
12545  } else
12546  {
12547  // line displayed calculate distance to line segments:
12548  QVector<QPointF> *lineData = new QVector<QPointF>;
12549  getPlotData(lineData, 0); // unlike with getScatterPlotData we get pixel coordinates here
12550  double minDistSqr = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
12551  if (mLineStyle == lsImpulse)
12552  {
12553  // impulse plot differs from other line styles in that the lineData points are only pairwise connected:
12554  for (int i=0; i<lineData->size()-1; i+=2) // iterate pairs
12555  {
12556  double currentDistSqr = distSqrToLine(lineData->at(i), lineData->at(i+1), pixelPoint);
12557  if (currentDistSqr < minDistSqr)
12558  minDistSqr = currentDistSqr;
12559  }
12560  } else
12561  {
12562  // all other line plots (line and step) connect points directly:
12563  for (int i=0; i<lineData->size()-1; ++i)
12564  {
12565  double currentDistSqr = distSqrToLine(lineData->at(i), lineData->at(i+1), pixelPoint);
12566  if (currentDistSqr < minDistSqr)
12567  minDistSqr = currentDistSqr;
12568  }
12569  }
12570  delete lineData;
12571  return sqrt(minDistSqr);
12572  }
12573 }
12574 
12583 int QCPGraph::findIndexBelowY(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double y) const
12584 {
12585  for (int i=data->size()-1; i>=0; --i)
12586  {
12587  if (data->at(i).y() > y)
12588  {
12589  if (i<data->size()-1)
12590  return i+1;
12591  else
12592  return data->size()-1;
12593  }
12594  }
12595  return -1;
12596 }
12597 
12598 /* inherits documentation from base class */
12599 QCPRange QCPGraph::getKeyRange(bool &validRange, SignDomain inSignDomain) const
12600 {
12601  // just call the specialized version which takes an additional argument whether error bars
12602  // should also be taken into consideration for range calculation. We set this to true here.
12603  return getKeyRange(validRange, inSignDomain, true);
12604 }
12605 
12606 /* inherits documentation from base class */
12607 QCPRange QCPGraph::getValueRange(bool &validRange, SignDomain inSignDomain) const
12608 {
12609  // just call the specialized version which takes an additional argument whether error bars
12610  // should also be taken into consideration for range calculation. We set this to true here.
12611  return getValueRange(validRange, inSignDomain, true);
12612 }
12613 
12620 QCPRange QCPGraph::getKeyRange(bool &validRange, SignDomain inSignDomain, bool includeErrors) const
12621 {
12622  QCPRange range;
12623  bool haveLower = false;
12624  bool haveUpper = false;
12625 
12626  double current, currentErrorMinus, currentErrorPlus;
12627 
12628  if (inSignDomain == sdBoth) // range may be anywhere
12629  {
12630  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
12631  while (it != mData->constEnd())
12632  {
12633  current = it.value().key;
12634  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorMinus : 0);
12635  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorPlus : 0);
12636  if (current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower)
12637  {
12638  range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
12639  haveLower = true;
12640  }
12641  if (current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper)
12642  {
12643  range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
12644  haveUpper = true;
12645  }
12646  ++it;
12647  }
12648  } else if (inSignDomain == sdNegative) // range may only be in the negative sign domain
12649  {
12650  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
12651  while (it != mData->constEnd())
12652  {
12653  current = it.value().key;
12654  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorMinus : 0);
12655  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorPlus : 0);
12656  if ((current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower) && current-currentErrorMinus < 0)
12657  {
12658  range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
12659  haveLower = true;
12660  }
12661  if ((current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current+currentErrorPlus < 0)
12662  {
12663  range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
12664  haveUpper = true;
12665  }
12666  if (includeErrors) // in case point is in valid sign domain but errobars stretch beyond it, we still want to geht that point.
12667  {
12668  if ((current < range.lower || !haveLower) && current < 0)
12669  {
12670  range.lower = current;
12671  haveLower = true;
12672  }
12673  if ((current > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current < 0)
12674  {
12675  range.upper = current;
12676  haveUpper = true;
12677  }
12678  }
12679  ++it;
12680  }
12681  } else if (inSignDomain == sdPositive) // range may only be in the positive sign domain
12682  {
12683  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
12684  while (it != mData->constEnd())
12685  {
12686  current = it.value().key;
12687  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorMinus : 0);
12688  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorPlus : 0);
12689  if ((current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower) && current-currentErrorMinus > 0)
12690  {
12691  range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
12692  haveLower = true;
12693  }
12694  if ((current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current+currentErrorPlus > 0)
12695  {
12696  range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
12697  haveUpper = true;
12698  }
12699  if (includeErrors) // in case point is in valid sign domain but errobars stretch beyond it, we still want to get that point.
12700  {
12701  if ((current < range.lower || !haveLower) && current > 0)
12702  {
12703  range.lower = current;
12704  haveLower = true;
12705  }
12706  if ((current > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current > 0)
12707  {
12708  range.upper = current;
12709  haveUpper = true;
12710  }
12711  }
12712  ++it;
12713  }
12714  }
12715 
12716  validRange = haveLower && haveUpper;
12717  return range;
12718 }
12719 
12726 QCPRange QCPGraph::getValueRange(bool &validRange, SignDomain inSignDomain, bool includeErrors) const
12727 {
12728  QCPRange range;
12729  bool haveLower = false;
12730  bool haveUpper = false;
12731 
12732  double current, currentErrorMinus, currentErrorPlus;
12733 
12734  if (inSignDomain == sdBoth) // range may be anywhere
12735  {
12736  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
12737  while (it != mData->constEnd())
12738  {
12739  current = it.value().value;
12740  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorMinus : 0);
12741  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorPlus : 0);
12742  if (current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower)
12743  {
12744  range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
12745  haveLower = true;
12746  }
12747  if (current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper)
12748  {
12749  range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
12750  haveUpper = true;
12751  }
12752  ++it;
12753  }
12754  } else if (inSignDomain == sdNegative) // range may only be in the negative sign domain
12755  {
12756  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
12757  while (it != mData->constEnd())
12758  {
12759  current = it.value().value;
12760  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorMinus : 0);
12761  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorPlus : 0);
12762  if ((current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower) && current-currentErrorMinus < 0)
12763  {
12764  range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
12765  haveLower = true;
12766  }
12767  if ((current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current+currentErrorPlus < 0)
12768  {
12769  range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
12770  haveUpper = true;
12771  }
12772  if (includeErrors) // in case point is in valid sign domain but errobars stretch beyond it, we still want to get that point.
12773  {
12774  if ((current < range.lower || !haveLower) && current < 0)
12775  {
12776  range.lower = current;
12777  haveLower = true;
12778  }
12779  if ((current > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current < 0)
12780  {
12781  range.upper = current;
12782  haveUpper = true;
12783  }
12784  }
12785  ++it;
12786  }
12787  } else if (inSignDomain == sdPositive) // range may only be in the positive sign domain
12788  {
12789  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
12790  while (it != mData->constEnd())
12791  {
12792  current = it.value().value;
12793  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorMinus : 0);
12794  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorPlus : 0);
12795  if ((current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower) && current-currentErrorMinus > 0)
12796  {
12797  range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
12798  haveLower = true;
12799  }
12800  if ((current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current+currentErrorPlus > 0)
12801  {
12802  range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
12803  haveUpper = true;
12804  }
12805  if (includeErrors) // in case point is in valid sign domain but errobars stretch beyond it, we still want to geht that point.
12806  {
12807  if ((current < range.lower || !haveLower) && current > 0)
12808  {
12809  range.lower = current;
12810  haveLower = true;
12811  }
12812  if ((current > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current > 0)
12813  {
12814  range.upper = current;
12815  haveUpper = true;
12816  }
12817  }
12818  ++it;
12819  }
12820  }
12821 
12822  validRange = haveLower && haveUpper;
12823  return range;
12824 }
12825 
12826 
12830 
12847 QCPCurveData::QCPCurveData() :
12848  t(0),
12849  key(0),
12850  value(0)
12851 {
12852 }
12853 
12857 QCPCurveData::QCPCurveData(double t, double key, double value) :
12858  t(t),
12859  key(key),
12860  value(value)
12861 {
12862 }
12863

12868 
12910 QCPCurve::QCPCurve(QCPAxis *keyAxis, QCPAxis *valueAxis) :
12911  QCPAbstractPlottable(keyAxis, valueAxis)
12912 {
12913  mData = new QCPCurveDataMap;
12914  mPen.setColor(Qt::blue);
12915  mPen.setStyle(Qt::SolidLine);
12916  mBrush.setColor(Qt::blue);
12917  mBrush.setStyle(Qt::NoBrush);
12918  mSelectedPen = mPen;
12919  mSelectedPen.setWidthF(2.5);
12920  mSelectedPen.setColor(QColor(80, 80, 255)); // lighter than Qt::blue of mPen
12921  mSelectedBrush = mBrush;
12922 
12923  setScatterStyle(QCPScatterStyle());
12924  setLineStyle(lsLine);
12925 }
12926 
12927 QCPCurve::~QCPCurve()
12928 {
12929  delete mData;
12930 }
12931 
12939 void QCPCurve::setData(QCPCurveDataMap *data, bool copy)
12940 {
12941  if (copy)
12942  {
12943  *mData = *data;
12944  } else
12945  {
12946  delete mData;
12947  mData = data;
12948  }
12949 }
12950 
12957 void QCPCurve::setData(const QVector<double> &t, const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value)
12958 {
12959  mData->clear();
12960  int n = t.size();
12961  n = qMin(n, key.size());
12962  n = qMin(n, value.size());
12963  QCPCurveData newData;
12964  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
12965  {
12966  newData.t = t[i];
12967  newData.key = key[i];
12968  newData.value = value[i];
12969  mData->insertMulti(newData.t, newData);
12970  }
12971 }
12972 
12978 void QCPCurve::setData(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value)
12979 {
12980  mData->clear();
12981  int n = key.size();
12982  n = qMin(n, value.size());
12983  QCPCurveData newData;
12984  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
12985  {
12986  newData.t = i; // no t vector given, so we assign t the index of the key/value pair
12987  newData.key = key[i];
12988  newData.value = value[i];
12989  mData->insertMulti(newData.t, newData);
12990  }
12991 }
12992 
13000 void QCPCurve::setScatterStyle(const QCPScatterStyle &style)
13001 {
13002  mScatterStyle = style;
13003 }
13004 
13012 void QCPCurve::setLineStyle(QCPCurve::LineStyle style)
13013 {
13014  mLineStyle = style;
13015 }
13016 
13021 void QCPCurve::addData(const QCPCurveDataMap &dataMap)
13022 {
13023  mData->unite(dataMap);
13024 }
13025 
13030 void QCPCurve::addData(const QCPCurveData &data)
13031 {
13032  mData->insertMulti(data.t, data);
13033 }
13034 
13039 void QCPCurve::addData(double t, double key, double value)
13040 {
13041  QCPCurveData newData;
13042  newData.t = t;
13043  newData.key = key;
13044  newData.value = value;
13045  mData->insertMulti(newData.t, newData);
13046 }
13047 
13056 void QCPCurve::addData(double key, double value)
13057 {
13058  QCPCurveData newData;
13059  if (!mData->isEmpty())
13060  newData.t = (mData->constEnd()-1).key()+1;
13061  else
13062  newData.t = 0;
13063  newData.key = key;
13064  newData.value = value;
13065  mData->insertMulti(newData.t, newData);
13066 }
13067 
13072 void QCPCurve::addData(const QVector<double> &ts, const QVector<double> &keys, const QVector<double> &values)
13073 {
13074  int n = ts.size();
13075  n = qMin(n, keys.size());
13076  n = qMin(n, values.size());
13077  QCPCurveData newData;
13078  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
13079  {
13080  newData.t = ts[i];
13081  newData.key = keys[i];
13082  newData.value = values[i];
13083  mData->insertMulti(newData.t, newData);
13084  }
13085 }
13086 
13091 void QCPCurve::removeDataBefore(double t)
13092 {
13093  QCPCurveDataMap::iterator it = mData->begin();
13094  while (it != mData->end() && it.key() < t)
13095  it = mData->erase(it);
13096 }
13097 
13102 void QCPCurve::removeDataAfter(double t)
13103 {
13104  if (mData->isEmpty()) return;
13105  QCPCurveDataMap::iterator it = mData->upperBound(t);
13106  while (it != mData->end())
13107  it = mData->erase(it);
13108 }
13109 
13117 void QCPCurve::removeData(double fromt, double tot)
13118 {
13119  if (fromt >= tot || mData->isEmpty()) return;
13120  QCPCurveDataMap::iterator it = mData->upperBound(fromt);
13121  QCPCurveDataMap::iterator itEnd = mData->upperBound(tot);
13122  while (it != itEnd)
13123  it = mData->erase(it);
13124 }
13125 
13135 void QCPCurve::removeData(double t)
13136 {
13137  mData->remove(t);
13138 }
13139 
13144 void QCPCurve::clearData()
13145 {
13146  mData->clear();
13147 }
13148 
13149 /* inherits documentation from base class */
13150 double QCPCurve::selectTest(const QPointF &pos, bool onlySelectable, QVariant *details) const
13151 {
13152  Q_UNUSED(details)
13153  if ((onlySelectable && !mSelectable) || mData->isEmpty())
13154  return -1;
13155 
13156  return pointDistance(pos);
13157 }
13158 
13159 /* inherits documentation from base class */
13160 void QCPCurve::draw(QCPPainter *painter)
13161 {
13162  if (mData->isEmpty()) return;
13163 
13164  // allocate line vector:
13165  QVector<QPointF> *lineData = new QVector<QPointF>;
13166 
13167  // fill with curve data:
13168  getCurveData(lineData);
13169 
13170  // check data validity if flag set:
13171 #ifdef QCUSTOMPLOT_CHECK_DATA
13172  QCPCurveDataMap::const_iterator it;
13173  for (it = mData->constBegin(); it != mData->constEnd(); ++it)
13174  {
13175  if (QCP::isInvalidData(it.value().t) ||
13176  QCP::isInvalidData(it.value().key, it.value().value))
13177  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "Data point at" << it.key() << "invalid." << "Plottable name:" << name();
13178  }
13179 #endif
13180 
13181  // draw curve fill:
13182  if (mainBrush().style() != Qt::NoBrush && mainBrush().color().alpha() != 0)
13183  {
13184  applyFillAntialiasingHint(painter);
13185  painter->setPen(Qt::NoPen);
13186  painter->setBrush(mainBrush());
13187  painter->drawPolygon(QPolygonF(*lineData));
13188  }
13189 
13190  // draw curve line:
13191  if (mLineStyle != lsNone && mainPen().style() != Qt::NoPen && mainPen().color().alpha() != 0)
13192  {
13193  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
13194  painter->setPen(mainPen());
13195  painter->setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
13196  // if drawing solid line and not in PDF, use much faster line drawing instead of polyline:
13197  if (mParentPlot->plottingHints().testFlag(QCP::phFastPolylines) &&
13198  painter->pen().style() == Qt::SolidLine &&
13199  !painter->modes().testFlag(QCPPainter::pmVectorized) &&
13200  !painter->modes().testFlag(QCPPainter::pmNoCaching))
13201  {
13202  for (int i=1; i<lineData->size(); ++i)
13203  painter->drawLine(lineData->at(i-1), lineData->at(i));
13204  } else
13205  {
13206  painter->drawPolyline(QPolygonF(*lineData));
13207  }
13208  }
13209 
13210  // draw scatters:
13211  if (!mScatterStyle.isNone())
13212  drawScatterPlot(painter, lineData);
13213 
13214  // free allocated line data:
13215  delete lineData;
13216 }
13217 
13218 /* inherits documentation from base class */
13219 void QCPCurve::drawLegendIcon(QCPPainter *painter, const QRectF &rect) const
13220 {
13221  // draw fill:
13222  if (mBrush.style() != Qt::NoBrush)
13223  {
13224  applyFillAntialiasingHint(painter);
13225  painter->fillRect(QRectF(rect.left(), rect.top()+rect.height()/2.0, rect.width(), rect.height()/3.0), mBrush);
13226  }
13227  // draw line vertically centered:
13228  if (mLineStyle != lsNone)
13229  {
13230  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
13231  painter->setPen(mPen);
13232  painter->drawLine(QLineF(rect.left(), rect.top()+rect.height()/2.0, rect.right()+5, rect.top()+rect.height()/2.0)); // +5 on x2 else last segment is missing from dashed/dotted pens
13233  }
13234  // draw scatter symbol:
13235  if (!mScatterStyle.isNone())
13236  {
13237  applyScattersAntialiasingHint(painter);
13238  // scale scatter pixmap if it's too large to fit in legend icon rect:
13239  if (mScatterStyle.shape() == QCPScatterStyle::ssPixmap && (mScatterStyle.pixmap().size().width() > rect.width() || mScatterStyle.pixmap().size().height() > rect.height()))
13240  {
13241  QCPScatterStyle scaledStyle(mScatterStyle);
13242  scaledStyle.setPixmap(scaledStyle.pixmap().scaled(rect.size().toSize(), Qt::KeepAspectRatio, Qt::SmoothTransformation));
13243  scaledStyle.applyTo(painter, mPen);
13244  scaledStyle.drawShape(painter, QRectF(rect).center());
13245  } else
13246  {
13247  mScatterStyle.applyTo(painter, mPen);
13248  mScatterStyle.drawShape(painter, QRectF(rect).center());
13249  }
13250  }
13251 }
13252 
13258 void QCPCurve::drawScatterPlot(QCPPainter *painter, const QVector<QPointF> *pointData) const
13259 {
13260  // draw scatter point symbols:
13261  applyScattersAntialiasingHint(painter);
13262  mScatterStyle.applyTo(painter, mPen);
13263  for (int i=0; i<pointData->size(); ++i)
13264  mScatterStyle.drawShape(painter, pointData->at(i));
13265 }
13266 
13273 void QCPCurve::getCurveData(QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const
13274 {
13275  /* Extended sides of axis rect R divide space into 9 regions:
13276  1__|_4_|__7
13277  2__|_R_|__8
13278  3 | 6 | 9
13279  General idea: If the two points of a line segment are in the same region (that is not R), the line segment corner is removed.
13280  Curves outside R become straight lines closely outside of R which greatly reduces drawing time, yet keeps the look of lines and
13281  fills inside R consistent.
13282  The region R has index 5.
13283  */
13284  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
13285  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
13286  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
13287 
13288  QRect axisRect = mKeyAxis.data()->axisRect()->rect() & mValueAxis.data()->axisRect()->rect();
13289  lineData->reserve(mData->size());
13290  QCPCurveDataMap::const_iterator it;
13291  int lastRegion = 5;
13292  int currentRegion = 5;
13293  double RLeft = keyAxis->range().lower;
13294  double RRight = keyAxis->range().upper;
13295  double RBottom = valueAxis->range().lower;
13296  double RTop = valueAxis->range().upper;
13297  double x, y; // current key/value
13298  bool addedLastAlready = true;
13299  bool firstPoint = true; // first point must always be drawn, to make sure fill works correctly
13300  for (it = mData->constBegin(); it != mData->constEnd(); ++it)
13301  {
13302  x = it.value().key;
13303  y = it.value().value;
13304  // determine current region:
13305  if (x < RLeft) // region 123
13306  {
13307  if (y > RTop)
13308  currentRegion = 1;
13309  else if (y < RBottom)
13310  currentRegion = 3;
13311  else
13312  currentRegion = 2;
13313  } else if (x > RRight) // region 789
13314  {
13315  if (y > RTop)
13316  currentRegion = 7;
13317  else if (y < RBottom)
13318  currentRegion = 9;
13319  else
13320  currentRegion = 8;
13321  } else // region 456
13322  {
13323  if (y > RTop)
13324  currentRegion = 4;
13325  else if (y < RBottom)
13326  currentRegion = 6;
13327  else
13328  currentRegion = 5;
13329  }
13330 
13331  /*
13332  Watch out, the next part is very tricky. It modifies the curve such that it seems like the
13333  whole thing is still drawn, but actually the points outside the axisRect are simplified
13334  ("optimized") greatly. There are some subtle special cases when line segments are large and
13335  thereby each subsequent point may be in a different region or even skip some.
13336  */
13337  // determine whether to keep current point:
13338  if (currentRegion == 5 || (firstPoint && mBrush.style() != Qt::NoBrush)) // current is in R, add current and last if it wasn't added already
13339  {
13340  if (!addedLastAlready) // in case curve just entered R, make sure the last point outside R is also drawn correctly
13341  lineData->append(coordsToPixels((it-1).value().key, (it-1).value().value)); // add last point to vector
13342  else if (lastRegion != 5) // added last already. If that's the case, we probably added it at optimized position. So go back and make sure it's at original position (else the angle changes under which this segment enters R)
13343  {
13344  if (!firstPoint) // because on firstPoint, currentRegion is 5 and addedLastAlready is true, although there is no last point
13345  lineData->replace(lineData->size()-1, coordsToPixels((it-1).value().key, (it-1).value().value));
13346  }
13347  lineData->append(coordsToPixels(it.value().key, it.value().value)); // add current point to vector
13348  addedLastAlready = true; // so in next iteration, we don't add this point twice
13349  } else if (currentRegion != lastRegion) // changed region, add current and last if not added already
13350  {
13351  // using outsideCoordsToPixels instead of coorsToPixels for optimized point placement (places points just outside axisRect instead of potentially far away)
13352 
13353  // if we're coming from R or we skip diagonally over the corner regions (so line might still be visible in R), we can't place points optimized
13354  if (lastRegion == 5 || // coming from R
13355  ((lastRegion==2 && currentRegion==4) || (lastRegion==4 && currentRegion==2)) || // skip top left diagonal
13356  ((lastRegion==4 && currentRegion==8) || (lastRegion==8 && currentRegion==4)) || // skip top right diagonal
13357  ((lastRegion==8 && currentRegion==6) || (lastRegion==6 && currentRegion==8)) || // skip bottom right diagonal
13358  ((lastRegion==6 && currentRegion==2) || (lastRegion==2 && currentRegion==6)) // skip bottom left diagonal
13359  )
13360  {
13361  // always add last point if not added already, original:
13362  if (!addedLastAlready)
13363  lineData->append(coordsToPixels((it-1).value().key, (it-1).value().value));
13364  // add current point, original:
13365  lineData->append(coordsToPixels(it.value().key, it.value().value));
13366  } else // no special case that forbids optimized point placement, so do it:
13367  {
13368  // always add last point if not added already, optimized:
13369  if (!addedLastAlready)
13370  lineData->append(outsideCoordsToPixels((it-1).value().key, (it-1).value().value, currentRegion, axisRect));
13371  // add current point, optimized:
13372  lineData->append(outsideCoordsToPixels(it.value().key, it.value().value, currentRegion, axisRect));
13373  }
13374  addedLastAlready = true; // so that if next point enters 5, or crosses another region boundary, we don't add this point twice
13375  } else // neither in R, nor crossed a region boundary, skip current point
13376  {
13377  addedLastAlready = false;
13378  }
13379  lastRegion = currentRegion;
13380  firstPoint = false;
13381  }
13382  // If curve ends outside R, we want to add very last point so the fill looks like it should when the curve started inside R:
13383  if (lastRegion != 5 && mBrush.style() != Qt::NoBrush && !mData->isEmpty())
13384  lineData->append(coordsToPixels((mData->constEnd()-1).value().key, (mData->constEnd()-1).value().value));
13385 }
13386 
13393 double QCPCurve::pointDistance(const QPointF &pixelPoint) const
13394 {
13395  if (mData->isEmpty())
13396  {
13397  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "requested point distance on curve" << mName << "without data";
13398  return 500;
13399  }
13400  if (mData->size() == 1)
13401  {
13402  QPointF dataPoint = coordsToPixels(mData->constBegin().key(), mData->constBegin().value().value);
13403  return QVector2D(dataPoint-pixelPoint).length();
13404  }
13405 
13406  // calculate minimum distance to line segments:
13407  QVector<QPointF> *lineData = new QVector<QPointF>;
13408  getCurveData(lineData);
13409  double minDistSqr = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
13410  for (int i=0; i<lineData->size()-1; ++i)
13411  {
13412  double currentDistSqr = distSqrToLine(lineData->at(i), lineData->at(i+1), pixelPoint);
13413  if (currentDistSqr < minDistSqr)
13414  minDistSqr = currentDistSqr;
13415  }
13416  delete lineData;
13417  return sqrt(minDistSqr);
13418 }
13419 
13431 QPointF QCPCurve::outsideCoordsToPixels(double key, double value, int region, QRect axisRect) const
13432 {
13433  int margin = qCeil(qMax(mScatterStyle.size(), (double)mPen.widthF())) + 2;
13434  QPointF result = coordsToPixels(key, value);
13435  switch (region)
13436  {
13437  case 2: result.setX(axisRect.left()-margin); break; // left
13438  case 8: result.setX(axisRect.right()+margin); break; // right
13439  case 4: result.setY(axisRect.top()-margin); break; // top
13440  case 6: result.setY(axisRect.bottom()+margin); break; // bottom
13441  case 1: result.setX(axisRect.left()-margin);
13442  result.setY(axisRect.top()-margin); break; // top left
13443  case 7: result.setX(axisRect.right()+margin);
13444  result.setY(axisRect.top()-margin); break; // top right
13445  case 9: result.setX(axisRect.right()+margin);
13446  result.setY(axisRect.bottom()+margin); break; // bottom right
13447  case 3: result.setX(axisRect.left()-margin);
13448  result.setY(axisRect.bottom()+margin); break; // bottom left
13449  }
13450  return result;
13451 }
13452 
13453 /* inherits documentation from base class */
13454 QCPRange QCPCurve::getKeyRange(bool &validRange, SignDomain inSignDomain) const
13455 {
13456  QCPRange range;
13457  bool haveLower = false;
13458  bool haveUpper = false;
13459 
13460  double current;
13461 
13462  QCPCurveDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
13463  while (it != mData->constEnd())
13464  {
13465  current = it.value().key;
13466  if (inSignDomain == sdBoth || (inSignDomain == sdNegative && current < 0) || (inSignDomain == sdPositive && current > 0))
13467  {
13468  if (current < range.lower || !haveLower)
13469  {
13470  range.lower = current;
13471  haveLower = true;
13472  }
13473  if (current > range.upper || !haveUpper)
13474  {
13475  range.upper = current;
13476  haveUpper = true;
13477  }
13478  }
13479  ++it;
13480  }
13481 
13482  validRange = haveLower && haveUpper;
13483  return range;
13484 }
13485 
13486 /* inherits documentation from base class */
13487 QCPRange QCPCurve::getValueRange(bool &validRange, SignDomain inSignDomain) const
13488 {
13489  QCPRange range;
13490  bool haveLower = false;
13491  bool haveUpper = false;
13492 
13493  double current;
13494 
13495  QCPCurveDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
13496  while (it != mData->constEnd())
13497  {
13498  current = it.value().value;
13499  if (inSignDomain == sdBoth || (inSignDomain == sdNegative && current < 0) || (inSignDomain == sdPositive && current > 0))
13500  {
13501  if (current < range.lower || !haveLower)
13502  {
13503  range.lower = current;
13504  haveLower = true;
13505  }
13506  if (current > range.upper || !haveUpper)
13507  {
13508  range.upper = current;
13509  haveUpper = true;
13510  }
13511  }
13512  ++it;
13513  }
13514 
13515  validRange = haveLower && haveUpper;
13516  return range;
13517 }
13518 
13519 
13523 
13539 QCPBarData::QCPBarData() :
13540  key(0),
13541  value(0)
13542 {
13543 }
13544 
13548 QCPBarData::QCPBarData(double key, double value) :
13549  key(key),
13550  value(value)
13551 {
13552 }
13553 
13554 
13558 
13615 QCPBars::QCPBars(QCPAxis *keyAxis, QCPAxis *valueAxis) :
13616  QCPAbstractPlottable(keyAxis, valueAxis)
13617 {
13618  mData = new QCPBarDataMap;
13619  mPen.setColor(Qt::blue);
13620  mPen.setStyle(Qt::SolidLine);
13621  mBrush.setColor(QColor(40, 50, 255, 30));
13622  mBrush.setStyle(Qt::SolidPattern);
13623  mSelectedPen = mPen;
13624  mSelectedPen.setWidthF(2.5);
13625  mSelectedPen.setColor(QColor(80, 80, 255)); // lighter than Qt::blue of mPen
13626  mSelectedBrush = mBrush;
13627 
13628  mWidth = 0.75;
13629 }
13630 
13631 QCPBars::~QCPBars()
13632 {
13633  if (mBarBelow || mBarAbove)
13634  connectBars(mBarBelow.data(), mBarAbove.data()); // take this bar out of any stacking
13635  delete mData;
13636 }
13637 
13641 void QCPBars::setWidth(double width)
13642 {
13643  mWidth = width;
13644 }
13645 
13653 void QCPBars::setData(QCPBarDataMap *data, bool copy)
13654 {
13655  if (copy)
13656  {
13657  *mData = *data;
13658  } else
13659  {
13660  delete mData;
13661  mData = data;
13662  }
13663 }
13664 
13671 void QCPBars::setData(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value)
13672 {
13673  mData->clear();
13674  int n = key.size();
13675  n = qMin(n, value.size());
13676  QCPBarData newData;
13677  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
13678  {
13679  newData.key = key[i];
13680  newData.value = value[i];
13681  mData->insertMulti(newData.key, newData);
13682  }
13683 }
13684 
13699 void QCPBars::moveBelow(QCPBars *bars)
13700 {
13701  if (bars == this) return;
13702  if (bars && (bars->keyAxis() != mKeyAxis.data() || bars->valueAxis() != mValueAxis.data()))
13703  {
13704  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "passed QCPBars* doesn't have same key and value axis as this QCPBars";
13705  return;
13706  }
13707  // remove from stacking:
13708  connectBars(mBarBelow.data(), mBarAbove.data()); // Note: also works if one (or both) of them is 0
13709  // if new bar given, insert this bar below it:
13710  if (bars)
13711  {
13712  if (bars->mBarBelow)
13713  connectBars(bars->mBarBelow.data(), this);
13714  connectBars(this, bars);
13715  }
13716 }
13717 
13732 void QCPBars::moveAbove(QCPBars *bars)
13733 {
13734  if (bars == this) return;
13735  if (bars && (bars->keyAxis() != mKeyAxis.data() || bars->valueAxis() != mValueAxis.data()))
13736  {
13737  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "passed QCPBars* doesn't have same key and value axis as this QCPBars";
13738  return;
13739  }
13740  // remove from stacking:
13741  connectBars(mBarBelow.data(), mBarAbove.data()); // Note: also works if one (or both) of them is 0
13742  // if new bar given, insert this bar above it:
13743  if (bars)
13744  {
13745  if (bars->mBarAbove)
13746  connectBars(this, bars->mBarAbove.data());
13747  connectBars(bars, this);
13748  }
13749 }
13750 
13755 void QCPBars::addData(const QCPBarDataMap &dataMap)
13756 {
13757  mData->unite(dataMap);
13758 }
13759 
13764 void QCPBars::addData(const QCPBarData &data)
13765 {
13766  mData->insertMulti(data.key, data);
13767 }
13768 
13773 void QCPBars::addData(double key, double value)
13774 {
13775  QCPBarData newData;
13776  newData.key = key;
13777  newData.value = value;
13778  mData->insertMulti(newData.key, newData);
13779 }
13780 
13785 void QCPBars::addData(const QVector<double> &keys, const QVector<double> &values)
13786 {
13787  int n = keys.size();
13788  n = qMin(n, values.size());
13789  QCPBarData newData;
13790  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
13791  {
13792  newData.key = keys[i];
13793  newData.value = values[i];
13794  mData->insertMulti(newData.key, newData);
13795  }
13796 }
13797 
13802 void QCPBars::removeDataBefore(double key)
13803 {
13804  QCPBarDataMap::iterator it = mData->begin();
13805  while (it != mData->end() && it.key() < key)
13806  it = mData->erase(it);
13807 }
13808 
13813 void QCPBars::removeDataAfter(double key)
13814 {
13815  if (mData->isEmpty()) return;
13816  QCPBarDataMap::iterator it = mData->upperBound(key);
13817  while (it != mData->end())
13818  it = mData->erase(it);
13819 }
13820 
13828 void QCPBars::removeData(double fromKey, double toKey)
13829 {
13830  if (fromKey >= toKey || mData->isEmpty()) return;
13831  QCPBarDataMap::iterator it = mData->upperBound(fromKey);
13832  QCPBarDataMap::iterator itEnd = mData->upperBound(toKey);
13833  while (it != itEnd)
13834  it = mData->erase(it);
13835 }
13836 
13845 void QCPBars::removeData(double key)
13846 {
13847  mData->remove(key);
13848 }
13849 
13854 void QCPBars::clearData()
13855 {
13856  mData->clear();
13857 }
13858 
13859 /* inherits documentation from base class */
13860 double QCPBars::selectTest(const QPointF &pos, bool onlySelectable, QVariant *details) const
13861 {
13862  Q_UNUSED(details)
13863  if (onlySelectable && !mSelectable)
13864  return -1;
13865 
13866  QCPBarDataMap::ConstIterator it;
13867  double posKey, posValue;
13868  pixelsToCoords(pos, posKey, posValue);
13869  for (it = mData->constBegin(); it != mData->constEnd(); ++it)
13870  {
13871  double baseValue = getBaseValue(it.key(), it.value().value >=0);
13872  QCPRange keyRange(it.key()-mWidth*0.5, it.key()+mWidth*0.5);
13873  QCPRange valueRange(baseValue, baseValue+it.value().value);
13874  if (keyRange.contains(posKey) && valueRange.contains(posValue))
13875  return mParentPlot->selectionTolerance()*0.99;
13876  }
13877  return -1;
13878 }
13879 
13880 /* inherits documentation from base class */
13881 void QCPBars::draw(QCPPainter *painter)
13882 {
13883  if (!mKeyAxis || !mValueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
13884  if (mData->isEmpty()) return;
13885 
13886  QCPBarDataMap::const_iterator it;
13887  for (it = mData->constBegin(); it != mData->constEnd(); ++it)
13888  {
13889  // skip bar if not visible in key axis range:
13890  if (it.key()+mWidth*0.5 < mKeyAxis.data()->range().lower || it.key()-mWidth*0.5 > mKeyAxis.data()->range().upper)
13891  continue;
13892  // check data validity if flag set:
13893 #ifdef QCUSTOMPLOT_CHECK_DATA
13894  if (QCP::isInvalidData(it.value().key, it.value().value))
13895  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "Data point at" << it.key() << "of drawn range invalid." << "Plottable name:" << name();
13896 #endif
13897  QPolygonF barPolygon = getBarPolygon(it.key(), it.value().value);
13898  // draw bar fill:
13899  if (mainBrush().style() != Qt::NoBrush && mainBrush().color().alpha() != 0)
13900  {
13901  applyFillAntialiasingHint(painter);
13902  painter->setPen(Qt::NoPen);
13903  painter->setBrush(mainBrush());
13904  painter->drawPolygon(barPolygon);
13905  }
13906  // draw bar line:
13907  if (mainPen().style() != Qt::NoPen && mainPen().color().alpha() != 0)
13908  {
13909  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
13910  painter->setPen(mainPen());
13911  painter->setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
13912  painter->drawPolyline(barPolygon);
13913  }
13914  }
13915 }
13916 
13917 /* inherits documentation from base class */
13918 void QCPBars::drawLegendIcon(QCPPainter *painter, const QRectF &rect) const
13919 {
13920  // draw filled rect:
13921  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
13922  painter->setBrush(mBrush);
13923  painter->setPen(mPen);
13924  QRectF r = QRectF(0, 0, rect.width()*0.67, rect.height()*0.67);
13925  r.moveCenter(rect.center());
13926  painter->drawRect(r);
13927 }
13928 
13934 QPolygonF QCPBars::getBarPolygon(double key, double value) const
13935 {
13936  QPolygonF result;
13937  double baseValue = getBaseValue(key, value >= 0);
13938  result << coordsToPixels(key-mWidth*0.5, baseValue);
13939  result << coordsToPixels(key-mWidth*0.5, baseValue+value);
13940  result << coordsToPixels(key+mWidth*0.5, baseValue+value);
13941  result << coordsToPixels(key+mWidth*0.5, baseValue);
13942  return result;
13943 }
13944 
13954 double QCPBars::getBaseValue(double key, bool positive) const
13955 {
13956  if (mBarBelow)
13957  {
13958  double max = 0;
13959  // find bars of mBarBelow that are approximately at key and find largest one:
13960  QCPBarDataMap::const_iterator it = mBarBelow.data()->mData->lowerBound(key-mWidth*0.1);
13961  QCPBarDataMap::const_iterator itEnd = mBarBelow.data()->mData->upperBound(key+mWidth*0.1);
13962  while (it != itEnd)
13963  {
13964  if ((positive && it.value().value > max) ||
13965  (!positive && it.value().value < max))
13966  max = it.value().value;
13967  ++it;
13968  }
13969  // recurse down the bar-stack to find the total height:
13970  return max + mBarBelow.data()->getBaseValue(key, positive);
13971  } else
13972  return 0;
13973 }
13974 
13983 void QCPBars::connectBars(QCPBars *lower, QCPBars *upper)
13984 {
13985  if (!lower && !upper) return;
13986 
13987  if (!lower) // disconnect upper at bottom
13988  {
13989  // disconnect old bar below upper:
13990  if (upper->mBarBelow && upper->mBarBelow.data()->mBarAbove.data() == upper)
13991  upper->mBarBelow.data()->mBarAbove.clear();
13992  upper->mBarBelow.clear();
13993  } else if (!upper) // disconnect lower at top
13994  {
13995  // disconnect old bar above lower:
13996  if (lower->mBarAbove && lower->mBarAbove.data()->mBarBelow.data() == lower)
13997  lower->mBarAbove.data()->mBarBelow.clear();
13998  lower->mBarAbove.clear();
13999  } else // connect lower and upper
14000  {
14001  // disconnect old bar above lower:
14002  if (lower->mBarAbove && lower->mBarAbove.data()->mBarBelow.data() == lower)
14003  lower->mBarAbove.data()->mBarBelow.clear();
14004  // disconnect old bar below upper:
14005  if (upper->mBarBelow && upper->mBarBelow.data()->mBarAbove.data() == upper)
14006  upper->mBarBelow.data()->mBarAbove.clear();
14007  lower->mBarAbove = upper;
14008  upper->mBarBelow = lower;
14009  }
14010 }
14011 
14012 /* inherits documentation from base class */
14013 QCPRange QCPBars::getKeyRange(bool &validRange, SignDomain inSignDomain) const
14014 {
14015  QCPRange range;
14016  bool haveLower = false;
14017  bool haveUpper = false;
14018 
14019  double current;
14020  double barWidthHalf = mWidth*0.5;
14021  QCPBarDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
14022  while (it != mData->constEnd())
14023  {
14024  current = it.value().key;
14025  if (inSignDomain == sdBoth || (inSignDomain == sdNegative && current+barWidthHalf < 0) || (inSignDomain == sdPositive && current-barWidthHalf > 0))
14026  {
14027  if (current-barWidthHalf < range.lower || !haveLower)
14028  {
14029  range.lower = current-barWidthHalf;
14030  haveLower = true;
14031  }
14032  if (current+barWidthHalf > range.upper || !haveUpper)
14033  {
14034  range.upper = current+barWidthHalf;
14035  haveUpper = true;
14036  }
14037  }
14038  ++it;
14039  }
14040 
14041  validRange = haveLower && haveUpper;
14042  return range;
14043 }
14044 
14045 /* inherits documentation from base class */
14046 QCPRange QCPBars::getValueRange(bool &validRange, SignDomain inSignDomain) const
14047 {
14048  QCPRange range;
14049  bool haveLower = true; // set to true, because 0 should always be visible in bar charts
14050  bool haveUpper = true; // set to true, because 0 should always be visible in bar charts
14051 
14052  double current;
14053 
14054  QCPBarDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
14055  while (it != mData->constEnd())
14056  {
14057  current = it.value().value + getBaseValue(it.value().key, it.value().value >= 0);
14058  if (inSignDomain == sdBoth || (inSignDomain == sdNegative && current < 0) || (inSignDomain == sdPositive && current > 0))
14059  {
14060  if (current < range.lower || !haveLower)
14061  {
14062  range.lower = current;
14063  haveLower = true;
14064  }
14065  if (current > range.upper || !haveUpper)
14066  {
14067  range.upper = current;
14068  haveUpper = true;
14069  }
14070  }
14071  ++it;
14072  }
14073 
14074  validRange = range.lower < range.upper;
14075  return range;
14076 }
14077 
14078 
14082 
14145 QCPStatisticalBox::QCPStatisticalBox(QCPAxis *keyAxis, QCPAxis *valueAxis) :
14146  QCPAbstractPlottable(keyAxis, valueAxis),
14147  mKey(0),
14148  mMinimum(0),
14149  mLowerQuartile(0),
14150  mMedian(0),
14151  mUpperQuartile(0),
14152  mMaximum(0)
14153 {
14154  setOutlierStyle(QCPScatterStyle(QCPScatterStyle::ssCircle, Qt::blue, 6));
14155  setWhiskerWidth(0.2);
14156  setWidth(0.5);
14157 
14158  setPen(QPen(Qt::black));
14159  setSelectedPen(QPen(Qt::blue, 2.5));
14160  setMedianPen(QPen(Qt::black, 3, Qt::SolidLine, Qt::FlatCap));
14161  setWhiskerPen(QPen(Qt::black, 0, Qt::DashLine, Qt::FlatCap));
14162  setWhiskerBarPen(QPen(Qt::black));
14163  setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
14164  setSelectedBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
14165 }
14166 
14170 void QCPStatisticalBox::setKey(double key)

14173 }

14206 {
14207  mMedian = value;
14208 }

14219  mUpperQuartile = value;
14220 }

14230  mMaximum = value;
14231 }

14243 }

14251 {

14254  setLowerQuartile(lowerQuartile);
14255  setMedian(median);
14256  setUpperQuartile(upperQuartile);
14257  setMaximum(maximum);
14258 }

14268 }

14278 }

14289 {
14290  mWhiskerPen = pen;
14291 }

14300 {
14301  mWhiskerBarPen = pen;

14321 
14322 /* inherits documentation from base class */
14323 void QCPStatisticalBox::clearData()
14324 {
14325  setOutliers(QVector<double>());
14326  setKey(0);
14327  setMinimum(0);
14328  setLowerQuartile(0);
14329  setMedian(0);
14330  setUpperQuartile(0);
14331  setMaximum(0);
14332 }
14333 
14334 /* inherits documentation from base class */
14335 double QCPStatisticalBox::selectTest(const QPointF &pos, bool onlySelectable, QVariant *details) const
14336 {
14337  Q_UNUSED(details)
14338  if (onlySelectable && !mSelectable)
14339  return -1;
14340  if (!mKeyAxis || !mValueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return -1; }
14341 
14342  double posKey, posValue;
14343  pixelsToCoords(pos, posKey, posValue);
14344  // quartile box:
14345  QCPRange keyRange(mKey-mWidth*0.5, mKey+mWidth*0.5);
14346  QCPRange valueRange(mLowerQuartile, mUpperQuartile);
14347  if (keyRange.contains(posKey) && valueRange.contains(posValue))
14348  return mParentPlot->selectionTolerance()*0.99;
14349 
14350  // min/max whiskers:
14351  if (QCPRange(mMinimum, mMaximum).contains(posValue))
14352  return qAbs(mKeyAxis.data()->coordToPixel(mKey)-mKeyAxis.data()->coordToPixel(posKey));
14353 
14354  return -1;
14355 }
14356 
14357 /* inherits documentation from base class */
14358 void QCPStatisticalBox::draw(QCPPainter *painter)
14359 {
14360  if (!mKeyAxis || !mValueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
14361 
14362  // check data validity if flag set:
14363 #ifdef QCUSTOMPLOT_CHECK_DATA
14364  if (QCP::isInvalidData(mKey, mMedian) ||
14365  QCP::isInvalidData(mLowerQuartile, mUpperQuartile) ||
14366  QCP::isInvalidData(mMinimum, mMaximum))
14367  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "Data point at" << mKey << "of drawn range has invalid data." << "Plottable name:" << name();
14368  for (int i=0; i<mOutliers.size(); ++i)
14369  if (QCP::isInvalidData(mOutliers.at(i)))
14370  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "Data point outlier at" << mKey << "of drawn range invalid." << "Plottable name:" << name();
14371 #endif
14372 
14373  QRectF quartileBox;
14374  drawQuartileBox(painter, &quartileBox);
14375 
14376  painter->save();
14377  painter->setClipRect(quartileBox, Qt::IntersectClip);
14378  drawMedian(painter);
14379  painter->restore();
14380 
14381  drawWhiskers(painter);
14382  drawOutliers(painter);
14383 }
14384 
14385 /* inherits documentation from base class */
14386 void QCPStatisticalBox::drawLegendIcon(QCPPainter *painter, const QRectF &rect) const
14387 {
14388  // draw filled rect:
14389  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
14390  painter->setPen(mPen);
14391  painter->setBrush(mBrush);
14392  QRectF r = QRectF(0, 0, rect.width()*0.67, rect.height()*0.67);
14393  r.moveCenter(rect.center());
14394  painter->drawRect(r);
14395 }
14396 
14403 void QCPStatisticalBox::drawQuartileBox(QCPPainter *painter, QRectF *quartileBox) const
14404 {
14405  QRectF box;
14406  box.setTopLeft(coordsToPixels(mKey-mWidth*0.5, mUpperQuartile));
14407  box.setBottomRight(coordsToPixels(mKey+mWidth*0.5, mLowerQuartile));
14408  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
14409  painter->setPen(mainPen());
14410  painter->setBrush(mainBrush());
14411  painter->drawRect(box);
14412  if (quartileBox)
14413  *quartileBox = box;
14414 }
14415 
14420 void QCPStatisticalBox::drawMedian(QCPPainter *painter) const
14421 {
14422  QLineF medianLine;
14423  medianLine.setP1(coordsToPixels(mKey-mWidth*0.5, mMedian));
14424  medianLine.setP2(coordsToPixels(mKey+mWidth*0.5, mMedian));
14425  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
14426  painter->setPen(mMedianPen);
14427  painter->drawLine(medianLine);
14428 }
14429 
14434 void QCPStatisticalBox::drawWhiskers(QCPPainter *painter) const
14435 {
14436  QLineF backboneMin, backboneMax, barMin, barMax;
14437  backboneMax.setPoints(coordsToPixels(mKey, mUpperQuartile), coordsToPixels(mKey, mMaximum));
14438  backboneMin.setPoints(coordsToPixels(mKey, mLowerQuartile), coordsToPixels(mKey, mMinimum));
14439  barMax.setPoints(coordsToPixels(mKey-mWhiskerWidth*0.5, mMaximum), coordsToPixels(mKey+mWhiskerWidth*0.5, mMaximum));
14440  barMin.setPoints(coordsToPixels(mKey-mWhiskerWidth*0.5, mMinimum), coordsToPixels(mKey+mWhiskerWidth*0.5, mMinimum));
14441  applyErrorBarsAntialiasingHint(painter);
14442  painter->setPen(mWhiskerPen);
14443  painter->drawLine(backboneMin);
14444  painter->drawLine(backboneMax);
14445  painter->setPen(mWhiskerBarPen);
14446  painter->drawLine(barMin);
14447  painter->drawLine(barMax);
14448 }
14449 
14454 void QCPStatisticalBox::drawOutliers(QCPPainter *painter) const
14455 {
14456  applyScattersAntialiasingHint(painter);
14457  mOutlierStyle.applyTo(painter, mPen);
14458  for (int i=0; i<mOutliers.size(); ++i)
14459  mOutlierStyle.drawShape(painter, coordsToPixels(mKey, mOutliers.at(i)));
14460 }
14461 
14462 /* inherits documentation from base class */
14463 QCPRange QCPStatisticalBox::getKeyRange(bool &validRange, SignDomain inSignDomain) const
14464 {
14465  validRange = mWidth > 0;
14466  if (inSignDomain == sdBoth)
14467  {
14468  return QCPRange(mKey-mWidth*0.5, mKey+mWidth*0.5);
14469  } else if (inSignDomain == sdNegative)
14470  {
14471  if (mKey+mWidth*0.5 < 0)
14472  return QCPRange(mKey-mWidth*0.5, mKey+mWidth*0.5);
14473  else if (mKey < 0)
14474  return QCPRange(mKey-mWidth*0.5, mKey);
14475  else
14476  {
14477  validRange = false;
14478  return QCPRange();
14479  }
14480  } else if (inSignDomain == sdPositive)
14481  {
14482  if (mKey-mWidth*0.5 > 0)
14483  return QCPRange(mKey-mWidth*0.5, mKey+mWidth*0.5);
14484  else if (mKey > 0)
14485  return QCPRange(mKey, mKey+mWidth*0.5);
14486  else
14487  {
14488  validRange = false;
14489  return QCPRange();
14490  }
14491  }
14492  validRange = false;
14493  return QCPRange();
14494 }
14495 
14496 /* inherits documentation from base class */
14497 QCPRange QCPStatisticalBox::getValueRange(bool &validRange, SignDomain inSignDomain) const
14498 {
14499  if (inSignDomain == sdBoth)
14500  {
14501  double lower = qMin(mMinimum, qMin(mMedian, mLowerQuartile));
14502  double upper = qMax(mMaximum, qMax(mMedian, mUpperQuartile));
14503  for (int i=0; i<mOutliers.size(); ++i)
14504  {
14505  if (mOutliers.at(i) < lower)
14506  lower = mOutliers.at(i);
14507  if (mOutliers.at(i) > upper)
14508  upper = mOutliers.at(i);
14509  }
14510  validRange = upper > lower;
14511  return QCPRange(lower, upper);
14512  } else
14513  {
14514  QVector<double> values; // values that must be considered (i.e. all outliers and the five box-parameters)
14515  values.reserve(mOutliers.size() + 5);
14516  values << mMaximum << mUpperQuartile << mMedian << mLowerQuartile << mMinimum;
14517  values << mOutliers;
14518  // go through values and find the ones in legal range:
14519  bool haveUpper = false;
14520  bool haveLower = false;
14521  double upper = 0;
14522  double lower = 0;
14523  for (int i=0; i<values.size(); ++i)
14524  {
14525  if ((inSignDomain == sdNegative && values.at(i) < 0) ||
14526  (inSignDomain == sdPositive && values.at(i) > 0))
14527  {
14528  if (values.at(i) > upper || !haveUpper)
14529  {
14530  upper = values.at(i);
14531  haveUpper = true;
14532  }
14533  if (values.at(i) < lower || !haveLower)
14534  {
14535  lower = values.at(i);
14536  haveLower = true;
14537  }
14538  }
14539  }
14540  // return the bounds if we found some sensible values:
14541  if (haveLower && haveUpper && lower < upper)
14542  {
14543  validRange = true;
14544  return QCPRange(lower, upper);
14545  } else
14546  {
14547  validRange = false;
14548  return QCPRange();
14549  }
14550  }
14551 }
14552 
14553 
14557 
14571 QCPItemStraightLine::QCPItemStraightLine(QCustomPlot *parentPlot) :
14572  QCPAbstractItem(parentPlot),
14573  point1(createPosition("point1")),
14574  point2(createPosition("point2"))
14575 {
14576  point1->setCoords(0, 0);
14577  point2->setCoords(1, 1);
14578 
14579  setPen(QPen(Qt::black));
14580  setSelectedPen(QPen(Qt::blue,2));
14581 }
14582 
14583 QCPItemStraightLine::~QCPItemStraightLine()
14584 {
14585 }
14586 
14592 void QCPItemStraightLine::setPen(const QPen &pen)
14593 {
14594  mPen = pen;
14595 }
14596 
14602 void QCPItemStraightLine::setSelectedPen(const QPen &pen)
14603 {
14604  mSelectedPen = pen;
14605 }
14606 
14607 /* inherits documentation from base class */
14608 double QCPItemStraightLine::selectTest(const QPointF &pos, bool onlySelectable, QVariant *details) const
14609 {
14610  Q_UNUSED(details)
14611  if (onlySelectable && !mSelectable)
14612  return -1;
14613 
14614  return distToStraightLine(QVector2D(point1->pixelPoint()), QVector2D(point2->pixelPoint()-point1->pixelPoint()), QVector2D(pos));
14615 }
14616 
14617 /* inherits documentation from base class */
14618 void QCPItemStraightLine::draw(QCPPainter *painter)
14619 {
14620  QVector2D start(point1->pixelPoint());
14621  QVector2D end(point2->pixelPoint());
14622  // get visible segment of straight line inside clipRect:
14623  double clipPad = mainPen().widthF();
14624  QLineF line = getRectClippedStraightLine(start, end-start, clipRect().adjusted(-clipPad, -clipPad, clipPad, clipPad));
14625  // paint visible segment, if existent:
14626  if (!line.isNull())
14627  {
14628  painter->setPen(mainPen());
14629  painter->drawLine(line);
14630  }
14631 }
14632 
14640 double QCPItemStraightLine::distToStraightLine(const QVector2D &base, const QVector2D &vec, const QVector2D &point) const
14641 {
14642  return qAbs((base.y()-point.y())*vec.x()-(base.x()-point.x())*vec.y())/vec.length();
14643 }
14644 
14652 QLineF QCPItemStraightLine::getRectClippedStraightLine(const QVector2D &base, const QVector2D &vec, const QRect &rect) const
14653 {
14654  double bx, by;
14655  double gamma;
14656  QLineF result;
14657  if (vec.x() == 0 && vec.y() == 0)
14658  return result;
14659  if (qFuzzyIsNull(vec.x())) // line is vertical
14660  {
14661  // check top of rect:
14662  bx = rect.left();
14663  by = rect.top();
14664  gamma = base.x()-bx + (by-base.y())*vec.x()/vec.y();
14665  if (gamma >= 0 && gamma <= rect.width())
14666  result.setLine(bx+gamma, rect.top(), bx+gamma, rect.bottom()); // no need to check bottom because we know line is vertical
14667  } else if (qFuzzyIsNull(vec.y())) // line is horizontal
14668  {
14669  // check left of rect:
14670  bx = rect.left();
14671  by = rect.top();
14672  gamma = base.y()-by + (bx-base.x())*vec.y()/vec.x();
14673  if (gamma >= 0 && gamma <= rect.height())
14674  result.setLine(rect.left(), by+gamma, rect.right(), by+gamma); // no need to check right because we know line is horizontal
14675  } else // line is skewed
14676  {
14677  QList<QVector2D> pointVectors;
14678  // check top of rect:
14679  bx = rect.left();
14680  by = rect.top();
14681  gamma = base.x()-bx + (by-base.y())*vec.x()/vec.y();
14682  if (gamma >= 0 && gamma <= rect.width())
14683  pointVectors.append(QVector2D(bx+gamma, by));
14684  // check bottom of rect:
14685  bx = rect.left();
14686  by = rect.bottom();
14687  gamma = base.x()-bx + (by-base.y())*vec.x()/vec.y();
14688  if (gamma >= 0 && gamma <= rect.width())
14689  pointVectors.append(QVector2D(bx+gamma, by));
14690  // check left of rect:
14691  bx = rect.left();
14692  by = rect.top();
14693  gamma = base.y()-by + (bx-base.x())*vec.y()/vec.x();
14694  if (gamma >= 0 && gamma <= rect.height())
14695  pointVectors.append(QVector2D(bx, by+gamma));
14696  // check right of rect:
14697  bx = rect.right();
14698  by = rect.top();
14699  gamma = base.y()-by + (bx-base.x())*vec.y()/vec.x();
14700  if (gamma >= 0 && gamma <= rect.height())
14701  pointVectors.append(QVector2D(bx, by+gamma));
14702 
14703  // evaluate points:
14704  if (pointVectors.size() == 2)
14705  {
14706  result.setPoints(pointVectors.at(0).toPointF(), pointVectors.at(1).toPointF());
14707  } else if (pointVectors.size() > 2)
14708  {
14709  // line probably goes through corner of rect, and we got two points there. single out the point pair with greatest distance:
14710  double distSqrMax = 0;
14711  QVector2D pv1, pv2;
14712  for (int i=0; i<pointVectors.size()-1; ++i)
14713  {
14714  for (int k=i+1; k<pointVectors.size(); ++k)
14715  {
14716  double distSqr = (pointVectors.at(i)-pointVectors.at(k)).lengthSquared();
14717  if (distSqr > distSqrMax)
14718  {
14719  pv1 = pointVectors.at(i);
14720  pv2 = pointVectors.at(k);
14721  distSqrMax = distSqr;
14722  }
14723  }
14724  }
14725  result.setPoints(pv1.toPointF(), pv2.toPointF());
14726  }
14727  }
14728  return result;
14729 }
14730 
14736 QPen QCPItemStraightLine::mainPen() const
14737 {
14738  return mSelected ? mSelectedPen : mPen;
14739 }
14740 
14741 
14745 
14761 QCPItemLine::QCPItemLine(QCustomPlot *parentPlot) :
14762  QCPAbstractItem(parentPlot),
14763  start(createPosition("start")),
14764  end(createPosition("end"))
14765 {
14766  start->setCoords(0, 0);
14767  end->setCoords(1, 1);
14768 
14769  setPen(QPen(Qt::black));
14770  setSelectedPen(QPen(Qt::blue,2));
14771 }
14772 
14773 QCPItemLine::~QCPItemLine()
14774 {
14775 }
14776 
14782 void QCPItemLine::setPen(const QPen &pen)
14783 {
14784  mPen = pen;
14785 }
14786 
14792 void QCPItemLine::setSelectedPen(const QPen &pen)
14793 {
14794  mSelectedPen = pen;
14795 }
14796 
14805 void QCPItemLine::setHead(const QCPLineEnding &head)
14806 {
14807  mHead = head;
14808 }
14809 
14818 void QCPItemLine::setTail(const QCPLineEnding &tail)
14819 {
14820  mTail = tail;
14821 }
14822 
14823 /* inherits documentation from base class */
14824 double QCPItemLine::selectTest(const QPointF &pos, bool onlySelectable, QVariant *details) const
14825 {
14826  Q_UNUSED(details)
14827  if (onlySelectable && !mSelectable)
14828  return -1;
14829 
14830  return qSqrt(distSqrToLine(start->pixelPoint(), end->pixelPoint(), pos));
14831 }
14832 
14833 /* inherits documentation from base class */
14834 void QCPItemLine::draw(QCPPainter *painter)
14835 {
14836  QVector2D startVec(start->pixelPoint());
14837  QVector2D endVec(end->pixelPoint());
14838  if (startVec.toPoint() == endVec.toPoint())
14839  return;
14840  // get visible segment of straight line inside clipRect:
14841  double clipPad = qMax(mHead.boundingDistance(), mTail.boundingDistance());
14842  clipPad = qMax(clipPad, (double)mainPen().widthF());
14843  QLineF line = getRectClippedLine(startVec, endVec, clipRect().adjusted(-clipPad, -clipPad, clipPad, clipPad));
14844  // paint visible segment, if existent:
14845  if (!line.isNull())
14846  {
14847  painter->setPen(mainPen());
14848  painter->drawLine(line);
14849  painter->setBrush(Qt::SolidPattern);
14850  if (mTail.style() != QCPLineEnding::esNone)
14851  mTail.draw(painter, startVec, startVec-endVec);
14852  if (mHead.style() != QCPLineEnding::esNone)
14853  mHead.draw(painter, endVec, endVec-startVec);
14854  }
14855 }
14856 
14864 QLineF QCPItemLine::getRectClippedLine(const QVector2D &start, const QVector2D &end, const QRect &rect) const
14865 {
14866  bool containsStart = rect.contains(start.x(), start.y());
14867  bool containsEnd = rect.contains(end.x(), end.y());
14868  if (containsStart && containsEnd)
14869  return QLineF(start.toPointF(), end.toPointF());
14870 
14871  QVector2D base = start;
14872  QVector2D vec = end-start;
14873  double bx, by;
14874  double gamma, mu;
14875  QLineF result;
14876  QList<QVector2D> pointVectors;
14877 
14878  if (!qFuzzyIsNull(vec.y())) // line is not horizontal
14879  {
14880  // check top of rect:
14881  bx = rect.left();
14882  by = rect.top();
14883  mu = (by-base.y())/vec.y();
14884  if (mu >= 0 && mu <= 1)
14885  {
14886  gamma = base.x()-bx + mu*vec.x();
14887  if (gamma >= 0 && gamma <= rect.width())
14888  pointVectors.append(QVector2D(bx+gamma, by));
14889  }
14890  // check bottom of rect:
14891  bx = rect.left();
14892  by = rect.bottom();
14893  mu = (by-base.y())/vec.y();
14894  if (mu >= 0 && mu <= 1)
14895  {
14896  gamma = base.x()-bx + mu*vec.x();
14897  if (gamma >= 0 && gamma <= rect.width())
14898  pointVectors.append(QVector2D(bx+gamma, by));
14899  }
14900  }
14901  if (!qFuzzyIsNull(vec.x())) // line is not vertical
14902  {
14903  // check left of rect:
14904  bx = rect.left();
14905  by = rect.top();
14906  mu = (bx-base.x())/vec.x();
14907  if (mu >= 0 && mu <= 1)
14908  {
14909  gamma = base.y()-by + mu*vec.y();
14910  if (gamma >= 0 && gamma <= rect.height())
14911  pointVectors.append(QVector2D(bx, by+gamma));
14912  }
14913  // check right of rect:
14914  bx = rect.right();
14915  by = rect.top();
14916  mu = (bx-base.x())/vec.x();
14917  if (mu >= 0 && mu <= 1)
14918  {
14919  gamma = base.y()-by + mu*vec.y();
14920  if (gamma >= 0 && gamma <= rect.height())
14921  pointVectors.append(QVector2D(bx, by+gamma));
14922  }
14923  }
14924 
14925  if (containsStart)
14926  pointVectors.append(start);
14927  if (containsEnd)
14928  pointVectors.append(end);
14929 
14930  // evaluate points:
14931  if (pointVectors.size() == 2)
14932  {
14933  result.setPoints(pointVectors.at(0).toPointF(), pointVectors.at(1).toPointF());
14934  } else if (pointVectors.size() > 2)
14935  {
14936  // line probably goes through corner of rect, and we got two points there. single out the point pair with greatest distance:
14937  double distSqrMax = 0;
14938  QVector2D pv1, pv2;
14939  for (int i=0; i<pointVectors.size()-1; ++i)
14940  {
14941  for (int k=i+1; k<pointVectors.size(); ++k)
14942  {
14943  double distSqr = (pointVectors.at(i)-pointVectors.at(k)).lengthSquared();
14944  if (distSqr > distSqrMax)
14945  {
14946  pv1 = pointVectors.at(i);
14947  pv2 = pointVectors.at(k);
14948  distSqrMax = distSqr;
14949  }
14950  }
14951  }
14952  result.setPoints(pv1.toPointF(), pv2.toPointF());
14953  }
14954  return result;
14955 }
14956 
14962 QPen QCPItemLine::mainPen() const
14963 {
14964  return mSelected ? mSelectedPen : mPen;
14965 }
14966 
14967 
14971 
14994 QCPItemCurve::QCPItemCurve(QCustomPlot *parentPlot) :
14995  QCPAbstractItem(parentPlot),
14996  start(createPosition("start")),
14997  startDir(createPosition("startDir")),
14998  endDir(createPosition("endDir")),
14999  end(createPosition("end"))
15000 {
15001  start->setCoords(0, 0);
15002  startDir->setCoords(0.5, 0);
15003  endDir->setCoords(0, 0.5);
15004  end->setCoords(1, 1);
15005 
15006  setPen(QPen(Qt::black));
15007  setSelectedPen(QPen(Qt::blue,2));
15008 }
15009 
15010 QCPItemCurve::~QCPItemCurve()
15011 {
15012 }
15013 
15019 void QCPItemCurve::setPen(const QPen &pen)
15020 {
15021  mPen = pen;
15022 }
15023 
15029 void QCPItemCurve::setSelectedPen(const QPen &pen)
15030 {
15031  mSelectedPen = pen;
15032 }
15033 
15042 void QCPItemCurve::setHead(const QCPLineEnding &head)
15043 {
15044  mHead = head;
15045 }
15046 
15055 void QCPItemCurve::setTail(const QCPLineEnding &tail)
15056 {
15057  mTail = tail;
15058 }
15059 
15060 /* inherits documentation from base class */
15061 double QCPItemCurve::selectTest(const QPointF &pos, bool onlySelectable, QVariant *details) const
15062 {
15063  Q_UNUSED(details)
15064  if (onlySelectable && !mSelectable)
15065  return -1;
15066 
15067  QPointF startVec(start->pixelPoint());
15068  QPointF startDirVec(startDir->pixelPoint());
15069  QPointF endDirVec(endDir->pixelPoint());
15070  QPointF endVec(end->pixelPoint());
15071 
15072  QPainterPath cubicPath(startVec);
15073  cubicPath.cubicTo(startDirVec, endDirVec, endVec);
15074 
15075  QPolygonF polygon = cubicPath.toSubpathPolygons().first();
15076  double minDistSqr = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
15077  for (int i=1; i<polygon.size(); ++i)
15078  {
15079  double distSqr = distSqrToLine(polygon.at(i-1), polygon.at(i), pos);
15080  if (distSqr < minDistSqr)
15081  minDistSqr = distSqr;
15082  }
15083  return qSqrt(minDistSqr);
15084 }
15085 
15086 /* inherits documentation from base class */
15087 void QCPItemCurve::draw(QCPPainter *painter)
15088 {
15089  QPointF startVec(start->pixelPoint());
15090  QPointF startDirVec(startDir->pixelPoint());
15091  QPointF endDirVec(endDir->pixelPoint());
15092  QPointF endVec(end->pixelPoint());
15093  if (QVector2D(endVec-startVec).length() > 1e10) // too large curves cause crash
15094  return;
15095 
15096  QPainterPath cubicPath(startVec);
15097  cubicPath.cubicTo(startDirVec, endDirVec, endVec);
15098 
15099  // paint visible segment, if existent:
15100  QRect clip = clipRect().adjusted(-mainPen().widthF(), -mainPen().widthF(), mainPen().widthF(), mainPen().widthF());
15101  QRect cubicRect = cubicPath.controlPointRect().toRect();
15102  if (cubicRect.isEmpty()) // may happen when start and end exactly on same x or y position
15103  cubicRect.adjust(0, 0, 1, 1);
15104  if (clip.intersects(cubicRect))
15105  {
15106  painter->setPen(mainPen());
15107  painter->drawPath(cubicPath);
15108  painter->setBrush(Qt::SolidPattern);
15109  if (mTail.style() != QCPLineEnding::esNone)
15110  mTail.draw(painter, QVector2D(startVec), M_PI-cubicPath.angleAtPercent(0)/180.0*M_PI);
15111  if (mHead.style() != QCPLineEnding::esNone)
15112  mHead.draw(painter, QVector2D(endVec), -cubicPath.angleAtPercent(1)/180.0*M_PI);
15113  }
15114 }
15115 
15121 QPen QCPItemCurve::mainPen() const
15122 {
15123  return mSelected ? mSelectedPen : mPen;
15124 }
15125 
15126 
15130 
15144 QCPItemRect::QCPItemRect(QCustomPlot *parentPlot) :
15145  QCPAbstractItem(parentPlot),
15146  topLeft(createPosition("topLeft")),
15147  bottomRight(createPosition("bottomRight")),
15148  top(createAnchor("top", aiTop)),
15149  topRight(createAnchor("topRight", aiTopRight)),
15150  right(createAnchor("right", aiRight)),
15151  bottom(createAnchor("bottom", aiBottom)),
15152  bottomLeft(createAnchor("bottomLeft", aiBottomLeft)),
15153  left(createAnchor("left", aiLeft))
15154 {
15155  topLeft->setCoords(0, 1);
15156  bottomRight->setCoords(1, 0);
15157 
15158  setPen(QPen(Qt::black));
15159  setSelectedPen(QPen(Qt::blue,2));
15160  setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
15161  setSelectedBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
15162 }

15186 }

15195 {
15196  mBrush = brush;
15197 }

15206 {
15207  mSelectedBrush = brush;
15208 }
15209 
15210 /* inherits documentation from base class */
15211 double QCPItemRect::selectTest(const QPointF &pos, bool onlySelectable, QVariant *details) const
15212 {
15213  Q_UNUSED(details)
15214  if (onlySelectable && !mSelectable)
15215  return -1;
15216 
15217  QRectF rect = QRectF(topLeft->pixelPoint(), bottomRight->pixelPoint()).normalized();
15218  bool filledRect = mBrush.style() != Qt::NoBrush && mBrush.color().alpha() != 0;
15219  return rectSelectTest(rect, pos, filledRect);
15220 }
15221 
15222 /* inherits documentation from base class */
15223 void QCPItemRect::draw(QCPPainter *painter)
15224 {
15225  QPointF p1 = topLeft->pixelPoint();
15226  QPointF p2 = bottomRight->pixelPoint();
15227  if (p1.toPoint() == p2.toPoint())
15228  return;
15229  QRectF rect = QRectF(p1, p2).normalized();
15230  double clipPad = mainPen().widthF();
15231  QRectF boundingRect = rect.adjusted(-clipPad, -clipPad, clipPad, clipPad);
15232  if (boundingRect.intersects(clipRect())) // only draw if bounding rect of rect item is visible in cliprect
15233  {
15234  painter->setPen(mainPen());
15235  painter->setBrush(mainBrush());
15236  painter->drawRect(rect);
15237  }
15238 }
15239 
15240 /* inherits documentation from base class */
15241 QPointF QCPItemRect::anchorPixelPoint(int anchorId) const
15242 {
15243  QRectF rect = QRectF(topLeft->pixelPoint(), bottomRight->pixelPoint());
15244  switch (anchorId)
15245  {
15246  case aiTop: return (rect.topLeft()+rect.topRight())*0.5;
15247  case aiTopRight: return rect.topRight();
15248  case aiRight: return (rect.topRight()+rect.bottomRight())*0.5;
15249  case aiBottom: return (rect.bottomLeft()+rect.bottomRight())*0.5;
15250  case aiBottomLeft: return rect.bottomLeft();
15251  case aiLeft: return (rect.topLeft()+rect.bottomLeft())*0.5;
15252  }
15253 
15254  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid anchorId" << anchorId;
15255  return QPointF();
15256 }
15257 
15263 QPen QCPItemRect::mainPen() const
15264 {
15265  return mSelected ? mSelectedPen : mPen;
15266 }
15267 
15273 QBrush QCPItemRect::mainBrush() const
15274 {
15275  return mSelected ? mSelectedBrush : mBrush;
15276 }

15302 QCPItemText::QCPItemText(QCustomPlot *parentPlot) :
15303  QCPAbstractItem(parentPlot),
15304  position(createPosition("position")),
15305  topLeft(createAnchor("topLeft", aiTopLeft)),
15306  top(createAnchor("top", aiTop)),
15307  topRight(createAnchor("topRight", aiTopRight)),
15308  right(createAnchor("right", aiRight)),
15309  bottomRight(createAnchor("bottomRight", aiBottomRight)),
15310  bottom(createAnchor("bottom", aiBottom)),
15311  bottomLeft(createAnchor("bottomLeft", aiBottomLeft)),
15312  left(createAnchor("left", aiLeft))
15313 {
15314  position->setCoords(0, 0);
15315 
15316  setRotation(0);
15317  setTextAlignment(Qt::AlignTop|Qt::AlignHCenter);
15318  setPositionAlignment(Qt::AlignCenter);
15319  setText("text");
15320 
15321  setPen(Qt::NoPen);
15322  setSelectedPen(Qt::NoPen);
15323  setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
15324  setSelectedBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
15325  setColor(Qt::black);
15326  setSelectedColor(Qt::blue);
15327 }
